The phone line in the cloud

  * Multi Line is a multi-user solution utilizing a physical telephone switchboard.
  * It operates on IP technology and includes the 'Unlimited Calls National/International' rate plan, enabling unlimited landline and mobile calling: 
    * unlimited calls from landline to landlines in Belgium

    * 1000 minutes/month from landline to: 
      * landlines and mobile numbers in Europe, Canada, and the USA
      * landlines in Morocco and Turkey

€25 /month for 2 users  
(in a Business Flex)

【33†Order now】

## Phone Line over IP

### Your caller never sounded so clear

  * 【34† HD quality 】 
  * 【35† Hear the difference yourself 】 
  * 【36† Questions? 】 

#### Excellent digital sound quality

Phone Line over IP technology is now included as standard in all new Business Flex packs. In practice, this mean that everyone who opts for a new Business Flex can make calls on a HD phone with excellent digital sound quality.

【37†Compose your Business Flex 】

You already have a pack with Phone Line and you also want to benefit from this excellent sound quaility? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 500 or visit a 【38†Proximus Shop】 to switch of charge to Phone Line over IP.

#### Listen and experience the difference yourself

How does it work?

Your calls go through your modem instead of the traditional voice channel. Since voices are first digitized by the HD phone, they’re transmitted almost undistorted. So, ideally, all callers should have a HD phone to get the most out of the quality.

Do call rates remain the same?

Calls in digital quality don't cost more than normal calls. The standard Phone Line rates remain applicable. And the HD phone itself is not expensive: you can get one for just €49.58 (VAT excl.).

Do you already have a pack with Phone Line?

Do you want to benefit from this excellent sound quality on your fixed phone? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 800 or visit a Proximus Shop to switch free of charge to Phone Line over IP. A Proximus technician will come by to install this technology (and, if necessary, a more recent modem) free of charge. Your can still use your current phone but to make calls in HD you will, of course, need a HD phone.

Does my communications over IP technology have an impact on my internet volume?

No. A call with IP technology has no impact on the internet volume.

I have an alarm, fax or other analog device. Is it compatible with Phone Line over IP?

If you don't have a telephone exchange, these devices can be directly connected to the "b-box 3V+" modem (2 ports possible).

For an alarm that uses the landline as a communication channel, we recommend you equip the line with a UPS battery (battery backup b-box 3V+) to prevent power cuts.

Old analog phones don't need any power. Does this also apply to devices with Phone Line over IP? What if there’s an electricity cut?

Phone Line over IP phones have to be connected to the electricity grid. To guarantee the functioning of devices for which continuity of voice and data connection is crucial (alarms, surveillance lines, etc.), we recommend you equip your modem with a battery (battery backup b-box 3V+). This battery ensures Phone Line over IP continues to work by providing one hour of electricity on a "b-box 3V+" modem and an optical-fiber modem (OLT: Optical Line Termination). To guarantee the functioning of your telephone exchange, we also recommend you opt for a UPS battery (Uninterruptable Power Supply).

What if IP is not available in my region? What are the alternatives?

In the rare cases where there no DSL access or optical fiber is available (less than 5% of Belgian territory), Proximus will continue to provide a traditional PSTN telephone service in the years to come.

## Even more advantageous in a Pack!

Choose for a pack Business Flex and call unlimited to all mobile and fixed numbers in Belgium.

【37† Choose your Business Flex 】 

[Image 4] 

## Recommended for you

### Paying options

Optimize your landline to it’s full potential with our paying services.

【39† I choose my option 】 

### Free services

Discover a wide range of free services included in your subscription.

【39† I take advantage 】

Wide range of fixed phones for every need

【40† I choose my phone 】 

 Conditions

  * 【42† Why keep a fixed line for your business? 】

All prices are VAT exclusive

Offer without fixed-term contract. Customers can cease having the product at any moment and without any penalty fees, provided they give 1 month notification.

【45†General Conditions】

Conditions Professional line (ISDN)

【45†General Conditions】

Conditions Bizz IP Telephony Multi

【45†General Conditions】

Conditions Phone Line over IP

【45†General Conditions】

Phone line installation charge

Installation lead time

Besides a junction box and a terminal (telephone, fax, etc.), the installation only requires a connection to the Proximus network.  
However, you do need the following Proximus infrastructure:

  * a lead-in cable that enters your building from the public domain
  * a connection point that terminates the Proximus infrastructure inside your building

If you do not have the appropriate infrastructure, please call our 【14†Customer Service†www.proximus.be】 in order to take the preliminary steps.

Your appointment will be confirmed by SMS and by telephone

We work hard to continuously improve our service. To make sure that our appointments for installations and repairs can proceed smoothly, all appointments are confirmed by SMS. Moreover, our technician will call you about 30 minutes before arriving at your premises.

The installation charges of €114.05 include:

  * Activation charge: €48.76
  * Fixed call-out charge: €40.50
  * Installation of junction box: €24.79

### Why keep a fixed line for your business?

Telephony and a fixed line are still very much alive and well in professional circles, and this for many reasons:

  * Reliable equipment
  * Hearing quality and comfort
  * The fixed line proves that your company has established premises
  * The fixed line gets you mentioned in the telephone directories

(in a Business Flex)

【33†Order now】

## Phone Line over IP

### Your caller never sounded so clear

  * 【34† HD quality 】 
  * 【35† Hear the difference yourself 】 
  * 【36† Questions? 】 

#### Excellent digital sound quality

Phone Line over IP technology is now included as standard in all new Business Flex packs. In practice, this mean that everyone who opts for a new Business Flex can make calls on a HD phone with excellent digital sound quality.

【37†Compose your Business Flex 】

You already have a pack with Phone Line and you also want to benefit from this excellent sound quaility? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 500 or visit a 【38†Proximus Shop】 to switch of charge to Phone Line over IP.

#### Listen and experience the difference yourself

How does it work?

Your calls go through your modem instead of the traditional voice channel. Since voices are first digitized by the HD phone, they’re transmitted almost undistorted. So, ideally, all callers should have a HD phone to get the most out of the quality.

Do call rates remain the same?

Calls in digital quality don't cost more than normal calls. The standard Phone Line rates remain applicable. And the HD phone itself is not expensive: you can get one for just €49.58 (VAT excl.).

Do you already have a pack with Phone Line?

Do you want to benefit from this excellent sound quality on your fixed phone? Then call our customer service on 0800 55 800 or visit a Proximus Shop to switch free of charge to Phone Line over IP. A Proximus technician will come by to install this technology (and, if necessary, a more recent modem) free of charge. Your can still use your current phone but to make calls in HD you will, of course, need a HD phone.

Does my communications over IP technology have an impact on my internet volume?

No. A call with IP technology has no impact on the internet volume.

I have an alarm, fax or other analog device. Is it compatible with Phone Line over IP?

If you don't have a telephone exchange, these devices can be directly connected to the "b-box 3V+" modem (2 ports possible).

For an alarm that uses the landline as a communication channel, we recommend you equip the line with a UPS battery (battery backup b-box 3V+) to prevent power cuts.

Old analog phones don't need any power. Does this also apply to devices with Phone Line over IP? What if there’s an electricity cut?

Phone Line over IP phones have to be connected to the electricity grid. To guarantee the functioning of devices for which continuity of voice and data connection is crucial (alarms, surveillance lines, etc.), we recommend you equip your modem with a battery (battery backup b-box 3V+). This battery ensures Phone Line over IP continues to work by providing one hour of electricity on a "b-box 3V+" modem and an optical-fiber modem (OLT: Optical Line Termination). To guarantee the functioning of your telephone exchange, we also recommend you opt for a UPS battery (Uninterruptable Power Supply).

What if IP is not available in my region? What are the alternatives?

In the rare cases where there no DSL access or optical fiber is available (less than 5% of Belgian territory), Proximus will continue to provide a traditional PSTN telephone service in the years to come.

## Even more advantageous in a Pack!

Choose for a pack Business Flex and call unlimited to all mobile and fixed numbers in Belgium.

【37† Choose your Business Flex 】 

[Image 4] 

## Recommended for you

### Paying options

Optimize your landline to it’s full potential with our paying services.

【39† I choose my option 】 

### Free services

Discover a wide range of free services included in your subscription.

【39† I take advantage 】

Wide range of fixed phones for every need

【40† I choose my phone 】 

 Conditions

All prices are VAT exclusive

Offer without fixed-term contract. Customers can cease having the product at any moment and without any penalty fees, provided they give 1 month notification.

Phone line installation charge

Installation lead time

Besides a junction box and a terminal (telephone, fax, etc.), the installation only requires a connection to the Proximus network.  
However, you do need the following Proximus infrastructure:

  * a lead-in cable that enters your building from the public domain
  * a connection point that terminates the Proximus infrastructure inside your building

If you do not have the appropriate infrastructure, please call our 【14†Customer Service†www.proximus.be】 in order to take the preliminary steps.

Your appointment will be confirmed by SMS and by telephone

We work hard to continuously improve our service. To make sure that our appointments for installations and repairs can proceed smoothly, all appointments are confirmed by SMS. Moreover, our technician will call you about 30 minutes before arriving at your premises.

The installation charges of €114.05 include:

  * Activation charge: €48.76
  * Fixed call-out charge: €40.50
  * Installation of junction box: €24.79

### Why keep a fixed line for your business?

Telephony and a fixed line are still very much alive and well in professional circles, and this for many reasons:

  * Reliable equipment
  * Hearing quality and comfort
  * The fixed line proves that your company has established premises
  * The fixed line gets you mentioned in the telephone directories

parts: 25€/mois/utilisateur....Sachant qu'il y a une seconde collègue à qui celle qui gère la centrale pourrait transférer des appels cela fera au minimum 75€/mois. (Miriam et les 2 nouvelles collègues) c'est très onéreux. Non ? Proximus ne fait pas un tarif spécial pour les asbl ?

Oui, effectivement, 75 €/mois pour trois utilisateurs peut rapidement devenir coûteux, surtout pour une petite asbl avec un budget limité. À ma connaissance, Proximus n'a pas de tarification spécifique directement dédiée aux **asbl** dans le cadre de leurs offres standards comme **Bizz Call Connect**. Cependant, il pourrait y avoir des offres personnalisées ou des réductions disponibles pour les non-profits, mais cela n'est généralement pas mentionné publiquement sur leur site.

Il est recommandé de contacter directement **Proximus** pour discuter de ta situation et voir s'ils peuvent te proposer un tarif adapté. Les grandes entreprises de télécommunication offrent souvent des tarifs personnalisés, surtout lorsqu'il s'agit de structures avec des besoins spécifiques comme une asbl.

Si cela ne fonctionne pas, il serait peut-être intéressant de comparer les offres avec d'autres opérateurs télécoms ou de revenir à une solution open-source comme **Asterisk** ou **FreePBX**, qui bien que plus complexe à configurer, pourraient à long terme s'avérer beaucoup plus économiques sans frais par utilisateur.

Je me suis souvenu et ai retrouvé mes accès sur 3CX, ils ont un plan  gratuit pour PME pour moi de 10 employés. J'ai un système. J'ai rajouté les employés. Mais pourrais-tu m'aider à configurer le système selon les besoins que je t'ai exprimés dans cette discussion stp ?
Voici le lien vers leur docs si cela peut t'aider : https://www.3cx.fr/docs/manuel/

Sébastien a retrouvé ses accès sur 3CX et a découvert qu'ils ont un plan gratuit pour PME pour moins de 10 employés. Il a rajouté les employés et souhaite de l'aide pour configurer le système selon les besoins exprimés précédemment.
Model set context updated.

Je peux t'aider à configurer ton système **3CX** selon tes besoins ! Voici les étapes pour que ta collègue puisse gérer la centrale d’appels depuis son laptop et transférer les appels, tout en gardant les autres configurations que tu souhaites en place. Je vais te guider sur les principaux points à configurer. 

### 1. **Installation et configuration de 3CX**
   - Si ce n’est pas déjà fait, assure-toi que le système 3CX est installé et correctement configuré sur ton serveur ou via un cloud (offert dans les options 3CX). Si tu as besoin de ressources, voici le manuel officiel [3CX Manuel](https://www.3cx.fr/docs/manuel/)【17†source】.
   
### 2. **Création des extensions pour les utilisateurs**
   - Va dans la section **“Extensions”** de l’interface 3CX et crée une extension pour chaque employé, y compris ta collègue qui gérera les appels. Ces extensions seront utilisées pour transférer les appels entre les utilisateurs. 
   - Attribue des **droits d'administration** spécifiques si tu veux que ta collègue ait un accès avancé pour gérer les appels entrants et sortants (via la gestion de la centrale).

### 3. **Configuration du Softphone**
   - Pour que ta collègue puisse gérer les appels depuis son laptop, elle aura besoin d'un **softphone**. 3CX propose son propre softphone intégré, que tu peux configurer en allant dans l'onglet **Clients Web ou Mobile**.
   - Ensuite, installe l’application 3CX sur son ordinateur et connecte-la à son extension via le QR code ou le lien de configuration envoyé par email via le système 3CX.

### 4. **Mise en place du renvoi et du transfert d’appels**
   - Dans l'interface de gestion de 3CX, va dans les **paramètres de l'extension** de la collègue qui gère les appels et configure la redirection d'appels :
     - Tu peux choisir de **rediriger les appels entrants vers le mobile** si elle n’est pas disponible sur son laptop.
     - Utilise la fonctionnalité **“Attente d'appel”** pour que plusieurs appels puissent être mis en attente et ensuite redirigés vers d’autres employés.
   
### 5. **Groupes d’appel et files d’attente**
   - Crée un **groupe d'appel** pour que les appels puissent être dirigés vers plusieurs extensions simultanément (par exemple, ta collègue et Miriam).
   - Si les appels doivent être redirigés après un certain délai, configure une **file d'attente** pour permettre à ta collègue de distribuer les appels lorsqu'elle est disponible.

### 6. **Messagerie vocale et redirection en dehors des heures d'ouverture**
   - Configure un message de bienvenue et la messagerie vocale via l'interface de **gestion des appels**.
   - Crée des règles d’horaires pour que les appels en dehors des heures de bureau soient redirigés vers une messagerie ou une autre extension.

### 7. **Accès mobile pour des transferts d'appels**
   - Assure-toi que les employés, y compris ta collègue, ont l’application **3CX Mobile** installée sur leur téléphone pour gérer les appels même lorsqu’ils ne sont pas au bureau.

Si tu veux des configurations spécifiques pour des fonctions plus avancées, n’hésite pas à me le dire, et je te guiderai plus en détail pour chaque étape.

Your cloud telephony solution.

## Manage your business calls as you wish

Professional greeting

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange
  * Easy management through a web portal or mobile app
  * Flexibility: add or remove users very easily

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary’s landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from €25 /month + free installation

【31†Request a quote】 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

【32† Discover the phones Opens a new window 】 

 Conditions 

  * 【33† General conditions 】 
  * 【34† Promotion conditions 】 

The 【35†Terms and Conditions】 and 【36†Pricelist & tariffs】 apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the « Bizz Switch » product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to   Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of € 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

Close the overlayer

With the Webex app, you can not only handle your landline calls on your smartphone, but also improve your workflows and stay connected thanks to a complete suite of team collaboration features (calls, voicemail, meetings and integration).

parts: Mais donc, théoriquement je n'aurai pas besoin de demander à Proximus un trunk SIP si le numéro central est le numéro de GSM de Miriam ?! Si ?

En théorie, **non**, tu n'aurais pas besoin de demander un trunk SIP à Proximus si le numéro central que tu utilises pour gérer les appels est un numéro de GSM, comme celui de **Miriam**. Un trunk SIP est principalement requis lorsque tu veux gérer des **lignes fixes** ou si tu as plusieurs **numéros virtuels** qui doivent être reliés à ton système 3CX via une connexion internet pour passer des appels.

Dans ton cas, si le numéro central est déjà un **numéro GSM**, tu peux tout simplement configurer **3CX** pour rediriger les appels entrants vers ce numéro via l’application mobile 3CX, qui peut gérer les appels en utilisant ce numéro sans passer par un trunk SIP. Cela simplifie la configuration, car tu utilises un **numéro mobile existant** et non un service VoIP ou une ligne fixe.

Voici comment cela fonctionne :
- Les appels entrants sur le numéro GSM peuvent être gérés via le système 3CX (softphone ou application mobile).
- **Pas besoin de SIP trunk** si tout le flux d'appels se fait via le réseau mobile de Proximus.
- Si tu veux passer par un trunk SIP à l'avenir (pour des fonctionnalités plus avancées ou des numéros supplémentaires), tu pourrais envisager d'ajouter cette fonctionnalité.

Donc, à moins que tu ne veuilles des fonctionnalités spécifiques liées à une ligne fixe ou à une architecture IP complète, ton **numéro GSM** de Miriam devrait suffire pour gérer tout via 3CX.
C'est quoi un SDA stp ?

Un **SDA** (Sélection Directe à l'Arrivée) est un numéro de téléphone qui permet de diriger directement un appel vers une extension ou un poste spécifique dans un système de téléphonie d'entreprise, sans passer par un standard ou un opérateur. En anglais, cela correspond à **DID** (Direct Inward Dialing).

Cela signifie que chaque employé ou service peut avoir un numéro unique, tout en étant connecté à une même ligne principale ou un même PBX (Private Branch Exchange). Par exemple, un client peut appeler directement une personne ou un département spécifique sans devoir passer par un numéro général.

Le SDA est souvent utilisé dans les entreprises qui ont besoin de plusieurs lignes directes pour différents employés ou services, tout en utilisant une seule ligne téléphonique centrale ou un PBX. 

Si tu utilises un système comme 3CX, tu pourrais théoriquement attribuer des SDA à tes employés ou collègues, si tu as plusieurs numéros, pour qu'ils puissent être joints directement.
Mais donc si je comprends je dois mettre le numéro de GSM comme SDA ?

Non, tu n'as pas besoin de configurer ton numéro GSM comme un **SDA** dans ton système 3CX, car le SDA (ou DID en anglais) est généralement utilisé pour des **numéros fixes** ou des **numéros virtuels** connectés à un système PBX via un trunk SIP.

Dans ton cas, si le **numéro central** de ton asbl est déjà un **numéro GSM**, tu n'as pas besoin d'un SDA supplémentaire pour acheminer les appels vers les différents collaborateurs, car les appels GSM sont déjà directement associés à ce numéro.

Voici la distinction :
- Un **SDA** est surtout utile si tu as un **trunk SIP** ou plusieurs lignes fixes, car il te permet d'acheminer un appel vers une extension ou un poste spécifique dans ton système PBX.
- Si tu utilises un **numéro GSM** comme numéro principal pour recevoir les appels, tu n'as pas besoin d'un SDA. Tu configurerais simplement ton système 3CX pour rediriger ou transférer les appels entrants à partir de ce numéro GSM vers les bonnes extensions (comme le softphone de ta collègue, par exemple).

Donc, dans ton cas, tu peux continuer à utiliser le numéro GSM de Miriam sans ajouter de SDA. Le système 3CX te permet ensuite de gérer la répartition des appels entrants vers les différentes personnes ou extensions.
Et pour regler la repartition des appels qui arrive sur ce numéro de gsm je dois faire ça où ? Dans l'interface d'administration ou sur le smartphone de Miriam dans l'application 3CX ?

Pour gérer la répartition des appels qui arrivent sur le numéro GSM de Miriam dans **3CX**, la configuration principale se fait dans **l'interface d'administration** de 3CX, plutôt que sur son smartphone.

Voici les étapes pour gérer cette répartition :

### 1. **Interface d’administration de 3CX** :
   - **Accéder à la console d’administration** de 3CX via ton navigateur.
   - Dans le menu à gauche, va dans la section **“Inbound Rules”** (règles des appels entrants).
   - Ici, tu pourras configurer les **règles d’acheminement des appels** entrants vers le numéro GSM de Miriam. Par exemple, tu peux :
     - **Rediriger les appels** vers une extension spécifique (comme le softphone de Miriam).
     - **Transférer les appels** vers un autre employé après un certain délai ou en cas d'absence.
     - Configurer une **file d'attente** ou un **groupe d'appels** si plusieurs personnes doivent pouvoir répondre aux appels.

### 2. **Application 3CX sur le smartphone** :
   - Miriam peut utiliser l’application **3CX Mobile** pour gérer ses appels, mais la **répartition automatique** des appels entrants doit être définie dans l'interface d'administration.
   - L'application permet de recevoir les appels, de les transférer manuellement ou de configurer des options comme la **disponibilité** (en ligne, occupée, etc.), mais la configuration des règles de transfert automatiques doit passer par la console admin.

En résumé, la gestion de la répartition automatique des appels entrants se fait dans la **console d’administration** 3CX. Miriam pourra utiliser son application mobile pour répondre et gérer les appels, mais la configuration principale se fait en amont dans l’interface de gestion.
Ok et pour ce qui est des groupe il semble il y en avoir 2

Il semble que tu aies déjà configuré deux groupes dans ton interface 3CX : le **Groupe Principal** et un groupe intitulé **Femmes de droit**.

### Pour gérer la répartition des appels dans ces groupes :
1. **Groupe Principal** :
   - Si ce groupe est destiné à gérer les appels entrants généraux, tu peux vérifier quelles extensions sont affectées à ce groupe et définir les règles de redirection si aucun utilisateur ne répond. Cela peut inclure le transfert vers un autre numéro ou vers une messagerie vocale.

2. **Femmes de droit** :
   - Ce groupe semble inclure plusieurs types de communication (Live Chat, Messages, Appels), mais si tu veux que les appels entrants vers ce groupe soient redirigés vers Miriam ou une autre personne, tu peux ajuster cela en cliquant sur le groupe et en modifiant la **destination de non-réponse**. Tu pourrais, par exemple, rediriger vers une extension spécifique ou une file d'attente.

### Étapes de configuration dans l'interface :
- **Modifier un groupe d'appel** : Clique sur l'un des groupes (par exemple, le **Groupe Principal**) pour voir quelles extensions sont associées et configurer les règles de transfert et les options d'attente.
- **Ajouter une nouvelle règle** : Si tu veux que les appels vers un groupe soient redirigés automatiquement, utilise l'option **Ajouter une règle de redirection**. Cela te permettra de configurer le transfert vers une extension ou un numéro GSM, selon le besoin.
- **Gérer la non-réponse** : Tu peux définir la destination de non-réponse, pour envoyer un appel vers un autre groupe ou vers un autre utilisateur si personne ne répond.

Cela te permet de diriger les appels facilement en fonction de la disponibilité de chaque personne. Si tu as des besoins spécifiques pour le transfert entre groupes ou des conditions de gestion d'appels, je peux t'aider à les configurer.

Peux-tu me confirmer pour que la solution 3CX SMB gratuite pour moins de 10 utilisateurs peut tout à fait fonctionner sans avoir besoin de trunk sip ? Sans poste fixe ? Que ce soit pour recevoir ou émettre des appels dans une équipe ou en externe vers d'autres numéros de téléphone ? Fais bien tes recherches stp. Assure toi de trouver des sources fiables avant de me répondre.

SIP trunking is a phone-system setup that enables your IP PBX phone system to make VoIP calls via the internet or PSTN, while VoIP is voice calling over the internet. SIP trunking is a setup method, while VoIP is a communication capability. While SIP trunk providers and cloud-hosted VoIP providers both offer VoIP, the two services differ in ...
# 【14†Configuring SIP Trunks / VoIP Providers in 3CX Phone System†www.3cx.com】
WHY 3CX. Configuring SIP Trunks / VoIP Providers in 3CX ® is ever so easy Take a look at this quick guide on how to do this in 3CX.
# 【15†A Practical Guide to Understanding SIP Trunks†www.sip.us】
SIP Trunks – These are the digital bridge, for making and receiving phone calls, as well as other communications over an internet connection. Purpose – They are the backbone of Voice over Internet Protocol (VoIP) technology, replacing the need for physical landlines. They consolidate multiple communication channels, effectively streamlining ...
# 【16†SIP Trunking 101: A Comprehensive SIP Trunking Guide†www.siptrunk.com】
As a primer, we’ll give you a quick timeline in this SIP trunking guide: 1876: Alexander Graham Bell makes the first successful telephone call. This telephone invention is the foundation of SIP trunking and VoIP. 1974: Danny Cohen makes the first VoIP call using Network Voice Protocol. 1995: VoIP technology became available to everyone after ...
# 【17†SIP Trunk Options in 3CX†www.3cx.com】
Which options are available in 3CX for SIP Trunks? Inbound and outbound calls, video calls, audio and more - it's all covered.
# 【18†Finding Affordable SIP Trunking Plans for Your Business†www.sip.us】
Average Costs of SIP Trunking for Businesses. The cost of SIP Trunking varies depending on several factors, including the provider and the specific needs of your business. On average, a business can expect to pay between $10 to $25 per SIP trunk each month. This translates to approximately $1 to $2 per user, but this can fluctuate based on your ...

# Can You Use 3CX For Free?

Read time:

2 Minutes 

3CX is a software based, cloud hosted telephone system used by businesses across the UK. 3CX is often advertised as a ‘free telephone system’, but how free is it really?  

As a 3CX authorised reseller and partner, we’re often asked about the differences between the free licenc

> 【68†hb1_ said:】 
> 
> So using one of these, say the HT801 from grandstream, will help assign my local landline to the 3cx system? So customers can call on the number assigned from my provider? 
> 
> Click to expand...

Correct  

remember you can only have one call at one time , either incoming or outgoing   

If you want to handle more external calls, you may wish to look a sip providers

【62† 】 

#### 【62†leejor】

Customer 

Joined
    Jan 22, 2008

Messages
    16,376

Reaction score
    1,566

  * 【69† Jul 24, 2021 】 

  * 【69† 】 
  * 【69† #5 】 

If there is even a chance, that you will add an additional PSTN line, in the future, it may be worthwhile to consider a multi-line gateway.   

If you find the need to place outgoing calls, when the PSTN line is engaged, you could add a SIP provider, just for outgoing. Many will allow you to send the same caller ID used by your your PSTN line so people will call back, on your existing line. This can usually be done with no monthly charge, just a very low cost for the time used. In the future, you might also consider porting over the PSTN number, to that same provider, once you become comfortable with VoIP.

  * 
Reactions: 【70†Naveen | Cal4care】

#### 【71†jcostlow】

Silver Partner 

Advanced Certified 

Joined
    Jul 11, 2020

Messages
    394

Reaction score
    152

  * 【72† Jul 24, 2021 】 

  * 【72† 】 
  * 【72† #6 】 

> 【68†hb1_ said:】 
> 
> So using one of these, say the HT801 from grandstream, will help assign my local landline to the 3cx system? So customers can call on the number assigned from my provider? 
> 
> Click to expand...

The HT801 is for connecting an analog phone or fax machine as an extension.   

You would want something like the Grandstream GXW4104 to connect a landline/PSTN phone line to 3CX.

Any of the gateways that say FXS at 【64†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/】 would work.

Hi 【81†hb1_】,  

You can choose any of the below supported FXO gateways to connect the PSTN lines.  

【82†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/grandstream-fxo/】  
【83†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/patton-smartnode-sn4112/】   
【84†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/beronet-berofix-400/】  

4 Port FXO Gateway- Available in all 3 brands.  
2 Port FXO Gateway - Available in Patton.  

Select the gateway model based on your budget and the future expansion of the PSTN trunk.

【83†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/patton-smartnode-sn4112/】   
【84†https://www.3cx.com/voip-gateways/beronet-berofix-400/】  

4 Port FXO Gateway- Available in all 3 brands.  
2 Port FXO Gateway - Available in Patton.  

Select the gateway model based on your budget and the future expansion of the PSTN trunk.

content.text:
The 3CX Enterprise plan includes all Professional plan features plus:

  * Voice Calling Features: Skills-based routing, pause-resume call recording, inbuilt failover, custom IP phone logo, standby license
  * Video Conferencing Features: Up to 250 video meeting participants
  * Third-Party Integrations: Microsoft Teams

## 3CX Phone System Top Features

3CX offers an impressive array of features across all plans, including voice and video calling, business SMS, website chat, team collaboration tools, and analytics. Below, we provide a quick overview of 3CX’s best features, which include call routing, ring groups, real-time reports, call flow design, and more.

### Call Switchboard

All paid 3CX plans include the call switchboard feature, which is an end-user dashboard for streamlined, one-click call management.

[Image 4: 3cx switchboard]

The switchboard displays real-time agent status, enables drag-and-drop call transfers (warm/blind), and lets users upgrade voice calls to an audio conference or video call. Within the switchboard, users can also send chat or text messages, record calls, leave voicemails, park calls, and place callers on hold.

Different switchboard views are available for agents, receptionists, admins, and managers.  Only managers have access to call monitoring, call barge, and call whisper capabilities, as well as live call queue monitoring via 3CX wallboards.

### Basic Voice Calling Features

[Image 5: 3cx business hour routing]

3CX offers numerous voice calling and call management features, including:

  * Interactive Voice Response (IVR): All paid 3CX plans include auto attendants and 【15†multi-level IVR】. Admins can upload pre-recorded call menus to direct inbound calls without involving a live agent. Each IVR menu can have up to 10 sub-menus that route callers to the best available call queue , extension, agent, or ring group.
  * Call Routing and Business Hour Rules: Paid 3CX plans include custom business hour routing rules that follow preset call paths during business hours, but forward calls to external numbers or voicemail boxes after office hours. The Small Business plan includes simultaneous call blasting and numerous 【44†call routing strategies】, including round robin, list-based, random, most idle, fewest answered calls, and lowest talk time routing. Custom routing strategies are also available. 【45†Skills-based routing】 is limited to the Professional and Enterprise plans.
  * Ring Groups and Call Queues: Admins can create ring groups of multiple agents with similar skill sets, schedules, or other criteria. Calls can be routed to these ring groups instead of individual agents, increasing the likelihood of an answer. Callers are sent to wait in customizable call queues if no agents are available. Enterprise users can access advanced call queue features like built-in post-call wrap-up time, call queue maximums, call queue email notifications, and priority queues.
  * Call Flow Designer: Enterprise and Professional 3CX plans include the self-managed call flow designer for more advanced IVR and call distribution. Users can also collect customer payments via phone, customize outbound dialing rules, access power dialing, specifically the amount of time between outbound calls, and create customer surveys.
  * Voicemail: All 3CX plans include voicemail messaging with a custom greeting, voicemail-to-email, real-time voicemail push notifications, and one-click callbacks. Voicemail transcription is available only to Professional and Enterprise users.
  * Call Recording: All 3CX paid plans include manual (on-demand) call recording, with pause-resume recording restricted to Enterprise plan holders. Searchable local and cloud recording storage is included. Recording transcription is only available via a paid OpenAI integration, which users must configure themselves.
  * Customer Callback: Instead of requiring customers to wait on hold, admins can enable 【46†customer callbacks】 to let customers schedule a time to receive a callback from an available agent.

### Business Messaging

3CX provides excellent business messaging features, enabling internal and external communication via live website chat, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, SMS, and instant team chat messaging.

[Image 6: 3cx website chat]

All messaging interactions, regardless of channel, are streamlined into a single inbox to avoid communication silos, with icons to identify the current messaging channel.

Agents can chat with website visitors to make product recommendations, provide customer support, and increase conversions. Admins can design chat queues to connect customers to the best available agent and create automatic message response templates with custom triggers. Team members can transfer live chats, share files and images with customers, mark chats as resolved, view chat interaction history, and create contacts from chat messages.

While agents can access individual and group team chat messaging and file sharing, 3CX lacks advanced team chat features like message threading, replies, and user mentions.

### Video Conferencing

All 3CX plans include unlimited HD video conferencing for desktop and mobile devices alongside in-meeting collaboration tools. The Free and Small Business plans limit meeting participants to 25, the Professional plan allows for 100 participants, and the Enterprise plan has a 250-participant cap.

[Image 7: 3cx video calling]

3CX video conferencing is browser-based, doesn’t store personal data, and doesn’t require users to download an app or create an account to join a video call. Meetings can be scheduled or on-demand, and hosts can share meeting links via a link, chat, email, WhatsApp, or QR code. Video conferences can be livestreamed to YouTube or screencast to Chromecast-enabled devices. Meeting lengths are unlimited, with up to 16 simultaneous screens and 50 simultaneous audio-only screens.

Personalized 3CX meeting links can be added to a business website, email signature, or social media account to enable instant video meetings with customers and other external users. Users can run audio and video tests before a meeting, blur their backgrounds, set meeting layouts, enable echo cancellation, and adjust participant video and audio controls.

In-meeting collaboration features include:

  * Team chat with Q&A
  * Screen sharing and remote control
  * File and PDF sharing and annotations
  * Virtual hand-raising, and polls
  * Whiteboards with drawing tools and templates

### Reporting and Analytics

All 3CX plans come with basic call logs and chat reports, but more advanced historical and live analytics are restricted to paid plans.

3CX lets managers review chat queue volumes, chat abandonment rate, chat channel popularity (website chat, SMS, Facebook, WhatsApp), and the number of chats individual agents handled over a custom date range. Users can integrate Google Analytics for more advanced chat and website interaction monitoring.

[Image 8: 3cx wallboards]

Live call center monitoring is available via the 3CX wallboard, shown in the above image. Users can review real-time call queue statistics, average wait a

## Act big… even when you’re small

[Image 1]

### A business number

Stop giving your personal number out for business purposes. Split social and business - contacts and hours - with 3CX SOHO Free.

[Image 2]

### No missed calls

You’re busy and can’t pick up? No problem. Don’t leave the phone ringing and your customer hanging. Route your calls.

【17†WhatsApp & Text】

Designed for more than just calls. Start managing inbound WhatsApp and text messages from one central place with the whole team helping.

【8†Live Chat】

Use the free website chat feature to convert website visitors and to re-engage with customers. Easy to install - perfect to use.

【57†Click2Call】

Let customers click on a number to launch a call right from your web page. You’ll stay in your workspace to collect the call without having to switch apps or devices.

【12†Remote working】

Best in class iOS, Android, Windows or Web apps let you stay connected, using your office number, no matter where you and your team are.

【58†Video conferencing 】

Schedule your meetings, presentations and team catch-ups via 3CX video conferencing feature. There’s no limits or extra costs and no additional sign-ups.

【59†Low cost upgrade 】

3CX adapts to your changing needs, so you’re never boxed in. As your business grows, upgrade to a low cost paid 3CX Small Business plan. It’s just a few clicks away.

## Getting started is easy!

### #1 Sign up for free to be set up in no time

3CX SOHO FREE is hosted by 3CX. This makes the installation process quick and easy. 【21†Sign up】, install, and you’re ready. We don’t make you sign a contract. You’re free to walk away at any time.

### #2 Bring your own SIP Trunk and number

You need a SIP trunk to place calls to external numbers. You also need one to have a number on which your customers can call. 3CX puts you in the driver’s seat for this. We don’t offer bundled numbers, so there’s no hidden charges or long term contracts that are impossible to get out of. You’re free to choose from a wide range of supported VoIP providers in the 【60†USA】, 【61†UK】, 【62†Australia】 and 【11†more】.

### #3 Community support

Join the 【23†3CX Community】. Seek advice or share opinions. While 3CX SOHO free is very easy to set up, the community is there for any additional support you might need. If you need more in depth help, 3CX is supported by a number of partners and resellers. They’re here to help, for an extra fee. 【9†Find a Partner】 near you.

[Image 3: Get 3CX absolutely free!]

It’s easy to get a SIP trunk from a VoIP Provider? Check out 【66†Callcentric】 in the US. In the UK and Europe, try 【67†Telxi†telxi.com】. For the full list check out our 【11†SIP Trunk providers】 page.

parts:
Pour utiliser la solution **3CX gratuite** pour les petites entreprises (moins de 10 utilisateurs), il est **possible** de la faire fonctionner sans avoir besoin d'un trunk SIP ni de téléphones fixes dans certaines conditions. Cependant, il y a quelques nuances à prendre en compte :

### Fonctionnement sans SIP Trunk :
- **Pour les appels internes** au sein de l'équipe (via softphones ou applications mobiles), 3CX peut fonctionner **sans SIP Trunk**. Les utilisateurs peuvent passer des appels via l’application 3CX sur leur smartphone ou leur ordinateur. Cela convient parfaitement pour des équipes qui travaillent à distance ou en télétravail.
  
- **Pour les appels externes** (vers des numéros de téléphones fixes ou mobiles), tu auras besoin d'un **SIP Trunk** ou d'une autre passerelle de téléphonie pour que ton système 3CX puisse se connecter au réseau téléphonique public (PSTN). Le plan gratuit de 3CX n'inclut pas de SIP Trunk par défaut, mais tu peux en configurer un via un fournisseur de VoIP compatible. Ce SIP Trunk est nécessaire pour émettre ou recevoir des appels externes via ton numéro central.

### Sans téléphones fixes :
- Le système 3CX est conçu pour être utilisé avec des **softphones** (applications sur smartphones ou ordinateurs). Tu n'as donc **pas besoin de téléphones fixes**. Toute ton équipe peut passer et recevoir des appels en utilisant les **applications mobiles** (iOS, Android) ou les **clients Web et Windows** de 3CX.

### Pour résumer :
- **Oui**, tu peux configurer et utiliser la solution gratuite de 3CX **sans poste fixe** et pour les appels internes. Toutefois, si tu souhaites émettre ou recevoir des appels externes, il te faudra un **SIP Trunk**. 

Cela te permet une solution flexible, mais pour les appels externes, l'ajout d'un SIP Trunk est indispensable. Si tu cherches un fournisseur de SIP Trunk, 3CX propose une liste de partenaires compatibles【45†source】【46†source】【48†source】.

Si tu as besoin de plus d'aide pour configurer ton système ou pour choisir un fournisseur de SIP, n'hésite pas à me le dire !

# Can You Use 3CX For Free?

Read time:

2 Minutes 

3CX is a software based, cloud hosted telephone system used by businesses across the UK. 3CX is often advertised as a ‘free telephone system’, but how free is it really?  

As a 3CX authorised reseller and partner, we’re often asked about the differences between the free licenc

> 【68†hb1_ said:】 
> 
> So using one of these, say the HT801 from grandstream, will help assign my local landline to the 3cx system? So customers can call on the number assigned from my provider? 
> 
> Click to expand...

Correct  

remember you can only have one call at one time , either incoming or outgoing   

If you want to handle more external calls, you may wish to look a sip providers

【62† 】 

#### 【62†leejor】

Customer 

Joined
    Jan 22, 2008

Messages
    16,376

Reaction score
    1,566

  * 【69† Jul 24, 2021 】 

  * 【69† 】 
  * 【69† #5 】 

If there is even a chance, that you will add an additional PSTN line, in the future, it may be worthwhile to consider a multi-line gateway.   

If you find the need to place outgoing calls, when the PSTN line is engaged, you could add a SIP provider, just for outgoing. Many will allow you to send the same caller ID used by your your PSTN line so people will call back, on your existing line. This can usually be done with no monthly charge, just a very low cost for the time used. In the future, you might also consider porting over the PSTN number, to that same provider, once you become comfortable with VoIP.

> So using one of these, say the HT801 from grandstream, will help assign my local landline to the 3cx system? So customers can call on the number assigned from my provider? 
> 
> Click to expand...

The HT801 is for connecting an analog phone or fax machine as an extension.   

You would want something like the Grandstream GXW4104 to connect a landline/PSTN phone line to 3CX.

Select the gateway model based on your budget and the future expansion of the PSTN trunk.

SMALL HOME OFFICE FREE PHONE SYSTEM

# Up to 10 users   
SOHO PHONE SYSTEM  
FREE FOREVER

Try it FREE

【56† †login.3cx.com】 【55† 】 

[Image 0: 3CX SOHO FREE] 

## Act big… even when you’re small

[Image 1]

### A business number

Stop giving your personal number out for business purposes. Split social and business - contacts and hours - with 3CX SOHO Free.

[Image 2]

### No missed calls

You’re busy and can’t pick up? No problem. Don’t leave the phone ringing and your customer hanging. Route your calls.

【17†WhatsApp & Text】

Designed for more than just calls. Start managing inbound WhatsApp and text messages from one central place with the whole team helping.

【8†Live Chat】

Use the free website chat feature to convert website visitors and to re-engage with customers. Easy to install - perfect to use.

【57†Click2Call】

Let customers click on a number to launch a call right from your web page. You’ll stay in your workspace to collect the call without having to switch apps or devices.

【12†Remote working】

Best in class iOS, Android, Windows or Web apps let you stay connected, using your office number, no matter where you and your team are.

【58†Video conferencing 】

Schedule your meetings, presentations and team catch-ups via 3CX video conferencing feature. There’s no limits or extra costs and no additional sign-ups.

【59†Low cost upgrade 】

3CX adapts to your changing needs, so you’re never boxed in. As your business grows, upgrade to a low cost paid 3CX Small Business plan. It’s just a few clicks away.

## Getting started is easy!

### #1 Sign up for free to be set up in no time

3CX SOHO FREE is hosted by 3CX. This makes the installation process quick and easy. 【21†Sign up】, install, and you’re ready. We don’t make you sign a contract. You’re free to walk away at any time.

### #2 Bring your own SIP Trunk and number

You need a SIP trunk to place calls to external numbers. You also need one to have a number on which your customers can call. 3CX puts you in the driver’s seat for this. We don’t offer bundled numbers, so there’s no hidden charges or long term contracts that are impossible to get out of. You’re free to choose from a wide range of supported VoIP providers in the 【60†USA】, 【61†UK】, 【62†Australia】 and 【11†more】.

### #3 Community support

Join the 【23†3CX Community】. Seek advice or share opinions. While 3CX SOHO free is very easy to set up, the community is there for any additional support you might need. If you need more in depth help, 3CX is supported by a number of partners and resellers. They’re here to help, for an extra fee. 【9†Find a Partner】 near you.

[Image 3: Get 3CX absolutely free!]

## 

Discover more benefits!

【13†App-free web conferencing】

【13† 】

【2†Easy management on-premise or hosted】

【2† 】

【63†Save up to 80% on your phone bills】

【63† 】

【12†Remote work with 3CX iOS/Android apps】

【12† 】

【8†Live chat & call with website visitors】

【8† 】

【64†Advanced call center features & reporting】

【64† 】

【17†Answer WhatsApp business messages 】

【17† 】

【18†Answer business texts (SMS)】

【18† 】

[Image 4: WhatsApp]

## Your questions answered...

### What features are included in the SOHO FREE edition?

The SOHO Free edition is tailored for small offices with up to 10 users, providing remote working apps for iOS, Android, Windows and a Web Client. It also includes call handling options, inbound WhatsApp, Live Chat, video calls for up to 25 people and 【65†more】.

### How do I get a SIP Trunk if I don't have one?

It’s easy to get a SIP trunk from a VoIP Provider? Check out 【66†Callcentric】 in the US. In the UK and Europe, try 【67†Telxi†telxi.com】. For the full list check out our 【11†SIP Trunk providers】 page.

### Do I need a 3CX phone system to use the mobile apps? 

Yes, to use our apps, you'll need a 3CX system. You've got choices: let 3CX host it for you in the cloud for a small fee or even for free. Or set it up yourself on your own server. Just know that the apps won't work unless you have a 3

If there is even a chance, that you will add an additional PSTN line, in the future, it may be worthwhile to consider a multi-line gateway.   

If you find the need to place outgoing calls, when the PSTN line is engaged, you could add a SIP provider, just for outgoing. Many will allow you to send the same caller ID used by your your PSTN line so people will call back, on your existing line. This can usually be done with no monthly charge, just a very low cost for the time used. In the future, you might also consider porting over the PSTN number, to that same provider, once you become comfortable with VoIP.

parts:
Haaa donc pour recevoir des appels externes aussi il faut un trunk sip ?
Qu'est-ce que c'est exactement ? Et pourquoi en faut-il un ? Si ma femme, Miriam a actuellement le numéro central d'appel de l'asbl dans son smartphone avec une double SIM, pourquoi l'application 3CX sur son smartphone ne dirige pas automatiquement les appels de ce numéro selon les règles définies dans la partie Traitement des appels du Dashboard 3CX ?

Pour bien comprendre pourquoi tu aurais besoin d'un **SIP Trunk** avec 3CX, il faut d'abord expliquer ce que c'est et pourquoi il est nécessaire dans certains cas.

### Qu'est-ce qu'un **SIP Trunk** ?
- Un **SIP Trunk** (Session Initiation Protocol Trunk) est un service qui permet à un système de téléphonie IP (comme 3CX) de se connecter au réseau téléphonique public (PSTN). En gros, il s'agit d'une "passerelle" qui permet à ton système VoIP (voix sur IP) de passer et de recevoir des appels vers/depuis des numéros externes (fixes ou mobiles).
- Un SIP Trunk remplace les lignes téléphoniques traditionnelles (comme les lignes analogiques ou numériques ISDN) et permet à ton système PBX (Private Branch Exchange, ici 3CX) d'interagir avec le réseau téléphonique.

### Pourquoi est-il nécessaire ?
- **Pour recevoir et passer des appels externes** avec 3CX, il faut obligatoirement un **SIP Trunk** ou une solution similaire qui se connecte au réseau téléphonique public (PSTN). 
- Si tu utilises uniquement 3CX pour des **appels internes** (c'est-à-dire au sein de ton organisation), tu n'as pas besoin de SIP Trunk. Mais dès que tu veux permettre à quelqu'un en dehors de ton organisation d'appeler ton numéro principal, ou que tu souhaites appeler un numéro de téléphone externe, tu as besoin de cette connexion.

### Pourquoi l'application 3CX ne redirige-t-elle pas automatiquement les appels du numéro central de Miriam ?
- **Numéro mobile et SIP Trunk** : Le fait que Miriam ait le numéro central de l'asbl sur son smartphone via une double SIM signifie que les appels à ce numéro sont gérés par son opérateur téléphonique (Proximus, par exemple) et non par 3CX. Pour que 3CX prenne le relais et puisse gérer les appels (avec ses règles, redirections, files d'attente, etc.), ce numéro doit être **routé via un SIP Trunk** ou un service VoIP compatible avec 3CX.
  
  Autrement dit, **3CX ne peut pas gérer les appels venant directement sur le numéro mobile de Miriam** tant qu'il n'est pas lié à un service VoIP ou SIP. 3CX est conçu pour intercepter et traiter les appels **via un réseau IP**. Les appels passés via le réseau GSM classique (de sa carte SIM) sont en dehors du contrôle de 3CX, sauf si tu utilises une solution de redirection spécifique.

### Solutions possibles :
1. **Portage du numéro vers un fournisseur SIP** : Tu pourrais envisager de **transférer/porter** le numéro GSM actuel vers un fournisseur VoIP compatible SIP. Cela permettrait à 3CX de gérer ce numéro comme un numéro principal via le dashboard, avec toutes les règles que tu définis dans 3CX.
2. **Redirection via opérateur** : Une autre solution serait de configurer une **redirection d'appel** depuis la ligne de Miriam (via son opérateur téléphonique) vers un **numéro VoIP** (fourni par un SIP Trunk), permettant à 3CX de prendre le contrôle de l'appel.

En résumé :
- **Pour gérer les appels externes** (entrant ou sortant), un **SIP Trunk** est nécessaire car c'est ce qui connecte ton système 3CX au réseau téléphonique public.
- Si Miriam utilise son numéro GSM pour recevoir des appels, ces appels sont gérés par son **opérateur mobile** et **non par 3CX**. Le numéro doit être converti en **numéro VoIP** (ou redirigé) pour que 3CX puisse appliquer ses règles d'appel. 

Cela explique pourquoi tu ne peux pas rediriger les appels entrants directement depuis son smartphone avec l'application 3CX sans SIP Trunk【45†source】【46†source】【47†source】.

metadata.title: 3CX Phone System: Pricing, Top Features, Pros & Cons
metadata.text:
The 3CX Enterprise plan includes all Professional plan features plus:

  * Voice Calling Features: Skills-based routing, pause-resume call recording, inbuilt failover, custom IP phone logo, standby license
  * Video Conferencing Features: Up to 250 video meeting participants
  * Third-Party Integrations: Microsoft Teams

## 3CX Phone System Top Features

3CX offers an impressive array of features across all plans, including voice and video calling, business SMS, website chat, team collaboration tools, and analytics. Below, we provide a quick overview of 3CX’s best features, which include call routing, ring groups, real-time reports, call flow design, and more.

### Call Switchboard

All paid 3CX plans include the call switchboard feature, which is an end-user dashboard for streamlined, one-click call management.

[Image 4: 3cx switchboard]

The switchboard displays real-time agent status, enables drag-and-drop call transfers (warm/blind), and lets users upgrade voice calls to an audio conference or video call. Within the switchboard, users can also send chat or text messages, record calls, leave voicemails, park calls, and place callers on hold.

Different switchboard views are available for agents, receptionists, admins, and managers.  Only managers have access to call monitoring, call barge, and call whisper capabilities, as well as live call queue monitoring via 3CX wallboards.

### Basic Voice Calling Features

[Image 5: 3cx business hour routing]

3CX offers numerous voice calling and call management features, including:

  * Interactive Voice Response (IVR): All paid 3CX plans include auto attendants and 【15†multi-level IVR】. Admins can upload pre-recorded call menus to direct inbound calls without involving a live agent. Each IVR menu can have up to 10 sub-menus that route callers to the best available call queue , extension, agent, or ring group.
  * Call Routing and Business Hour Rules: Paid 3CX plans include custom business hour routing rules that follow preset call paths during business hours, but forward calls to external numbers or voicemail boxes after office hours. The Small Business plan includes simultaneous call blasting and numerous 【44†call routing strategies】, including round robin, list-based, random, most idle, fewest answered calls, and lowest talk time routing. Custom routing strategies are also available. 【45†Skills-based routing】 is limited to the Professional and Enterprise plans.
  * Ring Groups and Call Queues: Admins can create ring groups of multiple agents with similar skill sets, schedules, or other criteria. Calls can be routed to these ring groups instead of individual agents, increasing the likelihood of an answer. Callers are sent to wait in customizable call queues if no agents are available. Enterprise users can access advanced call queue features like built-in post-call wrap-up time, call queue maximums, call queue email notifications, and priority queues.
  * Call Flow Designer: Enterprise and Professional 3CX plans include the self-managed call flow designer for more advanced IVR and call distribution. Users can also collect customer payments via phone, customize outbound dialing rules, access power dialing, specifically the amount of time between outbound calls, and create customer surveys.
  * Voicemail: All 3CX plans include voicemail messaging with a custom greeting, voicemail-to-email, real-time voicemail push notifications, and one-click callbacks. Voicemail transcription is available only to Professional and Enterprise users.
  * Call Recording: All 3CX paid plans include manual (on-demand) call recording, with pause-resume recording restricted to Enterprise plan holders. Searchable local and cloud recording storage is included. Recording transcription is only available via a paid OpenAI integration, which users must configure themselves.
  * Customer Callback: Instead of requiring customers to wait on hold, admins can enable 【46†customer callbacks】 to let customers schedule a time to receive a callback from an available agent.

### Business Messaging

3CX provides excellent business messaging features, enabling internal and external communication via live website chat, Facebook Messenger, WhatsApp, SMS, and instant team chat messaging.

[Image 6: 3cx website chat]

All messaging interactions, regardless of channel, are streamlined into a single inbox to avoid communication silos, with icons to identify the current messaging channel.

Agents can chat with website visitors to make product recommendations, provide customer support, and increase conversions. Admins can design chat queues to connect customers to the best available agent and create automatic message response templates with custom triggers. Team members can transfer live chats, share files and images with customers, mark chats as resolved, view chat interaction history, and create contacts from chat messages.

While agents can access individual and group team chat messaging and file sharing, 3CX lacks advanced team chat features like message threading, replies, and user mentions.

### Video Conferencing

All 3CX plans include unlimited HD video conferencing for desktop and mobile devices alongside in-meeting collaboration tools. The Free and Small Business plans limit meeting participants to 25, the Professional plan allows for 100 participants, and the Enterprise plan has a 250-participant cap.

[Image 7: 3cx video calling]

3CX video conferencing is browser-based, doesn’t store personal data, and doesn’t require users to download an app or create an account to join a video call. Meetings can be scheduled or on-demand, and hosts can share meeting links via a link, chat, email, WhatsApp, or QR code. Video conferences can be livestreamed to YouTube or screencast to Chromecast-enabled devices. Meeting lengths are unlimited, with up to 16 simultaneous screens and 50 simultaneous audio-only screens.

Personalized 3CX meeting links can be added to a business website, email signature, or social media account to enable instant video meetings with customers and other external users. Users can run audio and video tests before a meeting, blur their backgrounds, set meeting layouts, enable echo cancellation, and adjust participant video and audio controls.

In-meeting collaboration features include:

  * Team chat with Q&A
  * Screen sharing and remote control
  * File and PDF sharing and annotations
  * Virtual hand-raising, and polls
  * Whiteboards with drawing tools and templates

### Reporting and Analytics

All 3CX plans come with basic call logs and chat reports, but more advanced historical and live analytics are restricted to paid plans.

3CX lets managers review chat queue volumes, chat abandonment rate, chat channel popularity (website chat, SMS, Facebook, WhatsApp), and the number of chats individual agents handled over a custom date range. Users can integrate Google Analytics for more advanced chat and website interaction monitoring.

[Image 8: 3cx wallboards]

Live call center monitoring is available via the 3CX wallboard, shown in the above image. Users can review real-time call queue statistics, average wait a

If there is even a chance, that you will add an additional PSTN line, in the future, it may be worthwhile to consider a multi-line gateway.   

If you find the need to place outgoing calls, when the PSTN line is engaged, you could add a SIP provider, just for outgoing. Many will allow you to send the same caller ID used by your your PSTN line so people will call back, on your existing line. This can usually be done with no monthly charge, just a very low cost for the time used. In the future, you might also consider porting over the PSTN number, to that same provider, once you become comfortable with VoIP.

parts:
Ha ok donc sans ce Trunk SIP ou cette solution de redirection cela ne sert à rien en fait ?
Pourrais-tu me trouver des informations concernant ces possibilités chez Proximus. Notre FAI actuel. Je sais qu'il propose la solution Biz Call Connect avec en plus Webex (est-ce que Webex est un équivalent à 3CX ?) mais d'après ma collègue que les a appelé cela reviendra à seulement 20€/mois quel que soit le nombre d'utilisateur. 
Et donc en fait si je comprends bien, Proximus appel le service "Trunk SIP" -> Biz Call Connect ? Encore une fois sois sur de tes réponses stp. Si vraiment tu ne trouve pas j'appellerai Proximus.

content.text:
* Stay reachable, even while on the go
  * Make unlimited calls*

【28† Talk to an expert 】 

## Manage your business calls as you wish

[Image 0] 

Simultaneous calls

Your team can make and receive unlimited calls* through a landline number, all while having personal numbers.

[Image 1] 

Transfer, Forwarding, and Voicemail

You're in control. Redirect calls to another landline, a mobile, or your voicemail.

[Image 2] 

Professional greeting

Provide a tailored experience with a welcoming message, interactive menu, waiting music...

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange
  * Easy management through a web portal or mobile app
  * Flexibility: add or remove users very easily

* * *

#### Not a packs customer yet?

If you want to benefit from the Bizz Call Connect option, compose your Business pack

* * *

Option for Business Pack starting from

€25/month

【29†Request a quote】

Non binding subscription

Secured payment

Close the overlayer 

## Why buy online

### Non-binding subscription

  * Modify or cancel whenever you want
  * For free

* * *

### 100% secure payment

  * Choose between several payment methods:  
[Image 3: Visa] [Image 4: Mastercard] [Image 5: Bancontact] [Image 6: Maestro]
  * Possibility for (bi)-monthly invoice depending of ordered online product

* * *

【30†Do you need the aftersale service?】

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary’s landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from €25 /month + free installation

【31†Request a quote】 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

【32† Discover the phones Opens a new window 】 

 Conditions 

  * 【33† General conditions 】 
  * 【34† Promotion conditions 】 

The 【35†Terms and Conditions】 and 【36†Pricelist & tariffs】 apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the « Bizz Switch » product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to   Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of € 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

With the Webex app, you can not only handle your landline calls on your smartphone, but also improve your workflows and stay connected thanks to a complete suite of team collaboration features (calls, voicemail, meetings and integration).

Your team can make and receive unlimited calls* through a landline number, all while having personal numbers.

[Image 1] 

Transfer, Forwarding, and Voicemail

You're in control. Redirect calls to another landline, a mobile, or your voicemail.

[Image 2] 

Professional greeting

Provide a tailored experience with a welcoming message, interactive menu, waiting music...

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange
  * Easy management through a web portal or mobile app
  * Flexibility: add or remove users very easily

* * *

#### Not a packs customer yet?

If you want to benefit from the Bizz Call Connect option, compose your Business pack

* * *

Option for Business Pack starting from

€25/month

【29†Request a quote】

Non binding subscription

Secured payment

Close the overlayer 

## Why buy online

### Non-binding subscription

  * Modify or cancel whenever you want
  * For free

* * *

### 100% secure payment

  * Choose between several payment methods:  
[Image 3: Visa] [Image 4: Mastercard] [Image 5: Bancontact] [Image 6: Maestro]
  * Possibility for (bi)-monthly invoice depending of ordered online product

* * *

【30†Do you need the aftersale service?】

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary’s landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from €25 /month + free installation

【31†Request a quote】 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

【32† Discover the phones Opens a new window 】 

 Conditions 

  * 【33† General conditions 】 
  * 【34† Promotion conditions 】 

The 【35†Terms and Conditions】 and 【36†Pricelist & tariffs】 apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the « Bizz Switch » product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to   Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of € 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

Close the overlayer

With the Webex app, you can not only handle your landline calls on your smartphone, but also improve your workflows and stay connected thanks to a complete suite of team collaboration features (calls, voicemail, meetings and integration).
