content.text:
* Answer a call
  * Call someone in your organization

【32† Call people Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Advanced calling options 

Don't use native call settings in the Webex App. Proximus implemented dedicated advanced calls settings within the Webex App to allow automatic synchronisation  with the Call Connect Portal.  
To go to this section, follow these steps: 

  1. Click on your initials on the top left side of the screen.  
[Image 0]
  2. Click on Settings  
[Image 1]
  3. Click on Calling  
[Image 2]
  4. Click on Advanced call settings  
[Image 3]

Now you can learn how to:

  * Do not disturb : This activates automatic call forwarding to your voice mail, if it's activated. If voice mail isn't activated, your caller will hear a busy tone. To turn this option on or off in the Webex App. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Call Forwarding : There are different types of Call Forwarding: 
    * Always Forwarding: all your calls are forwarded to a specified number. This call forwarding always has priority over other call forwarding you have set.
    * No Answer Forwarding: when you don't pick up, your calls are forwarded to a specified number. You can choose the number of rings before a call is forwarded.
    * Busy Forwarding: when your line is busy, your calls are forwarded to a specified number.
In each of the above cases, you can also choose to forward your calls to your voicemail. If you forward calls to your voicemail, you cannot forward them to a specific number at the same time.  
To turn any of these options on or off in the Webex App: 
    1. Choose the desired option.
    2. Enter the phone number to which you want to forward your calls (e.g. 012123456). If you want to forward calls to your voicemail, do not enter a number. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Simultaneous ringing : Selective Simultaneous Ring ensures that certain phones ring at the same time. You can choose which phone numbers this applies to. If you don't want your employees' phones to start ringing when they're on a call, check Do not ring if on call.
  * Sequential ringing : Selective Sequential Ring ensures that phones ring in a specific order. You can draw up a list with your own order.
  * Remote office : This service allows you to link any number, even if not hosted on our network and all the calls will be forwarded to this destination. Enter a number first. Then To turn this option on or off in the Webex App:   
Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Call waiting : This allows you to take a second call while you're on the line with another caller.   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Block my caller ID : This hides your phone number when you call someone (secret number).   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.

* * *

### Message

With Webex Messaging, connect in real-time or any other time with advanced features for group messaging, file-sharing, whiteboarding, and more.

Send messages 

Learn how to:

  * Read a message
  * Send a message
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Forward messages
  * Get everyone's attention in a space
  * Quotes and threads
  * Format messages
  * Add fun to your messages with emojis
  * Delete messages and files

【33† Send message Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Organize your messages 

Learn how to:

  * Find people, spaces, messages, files and devices
  * Filter your @ mentions
  * Filter important messages
  * Get to your favourite spaces more quickly
  * Filter your spaces and content
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Hide less important spaces
  * Follows conversations more easily with threads

【34† Organize your messages Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share your content 

Learn how to:

  * Share Animated GIFs
  * Share Files with Others
  * Share Your Screen While Messaging
  * Share Files from Microsoft OneDrive or SharePoint Online
  * Share Files from Box
  * Create a Whiteboard in a Space

【35† Share your content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Meet

With Webex Meeting, stay connected with video conferencing that’s engaging, intelligent, and inclusive.

Set up your meeting preferences 

Learn how to: 

  * Change your audio settings
  * Change your video settings
  * Turn off notifications for incoming calls

【36† Set up your meeting preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Join meetings 

Learn how to: 

  * Join a Webex Meeting
  * Join a meeting from your Webex site
  * Register for a Webex Meeting or Event
  * Use a virtual background in the Webex Meetings suite

【37† Join meetings Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Schedule meetings 

Learn how to: 

  * Start a personal Room meeting
  * Start a meeting from a  space
  * Schedule a meeting from a space
  * Schedule a meeting using @webex or @meet

【38† Schedule meetings Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Connect to audio and video 

Learn how to: 

  * Mute or unmute other people in a meeting
  * Use a virtual or blurred background in calls and meetings

【39† Connect to audio and video Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share content 

Learn how to: 

  * Share your screen or application in a meeting

【35† Share content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Integrate Webex app to Microsoft Outlook

Improve the collaboration with your contacts by connecting your Microsoft Outlook account to the Webex application.

Connect Microsoft Outlook account to Webex app 

If you use a free Webex account, you can enable the integration in the settings if you are the administrator of your computer. If you use a paid Webex account (Webex for Call Connect, included in your Call Connect license), your administrator must enable the integration for you.

  * View the presence status of your contacts
  * Call your contacts
  * Send your contacts an instant message
  * Shedule and join a Webex meeting

【40† Webex integration to Microsoft Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

【41† Connect your user's Webex App status to Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

## 

★ ★ ★ ★ ★

###  Contact us 

####  Our employees are ready to help you! 

  * Call us on 【42†0800 55 200†tel:+3280055200】  
Administrative questions : Monday - Friday (from 8 a.m. until 6.30 p.m.)  
T

content.text:
【28† Set up calling preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Call people 

Learn how to: 

  * Make audio and video calls 
  * Answer a call
  * Call someone in your organization

【29† Call people Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Advanced calling options 

Don't use native call settings in the Webex App. Proximus implemented dedicated advanced calls settings within the Webex App to allow automatic synchronisation  with the Call Connect Portal.  
To go to this section, follow these steps: 

  1. Tap your initials on the top left side of the screen.  
[Image 0]
  2. Tap Settings  
[Image 1]
  3. Tap Calling  
[Image 2]
  4. Tap Advanced call settings  
[Image 3]

Now you can learn how to:

  * Do not disturb : This activates automatic call forwarding to your voice mail, if it's activated. If voice mail isn't activated, your caller will hear a busy tone. To turn this option on or off in the Webex App. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Call Forwarding : There are different types of Call Forwarding: 
    * Always Forwarding: all your calls are forwarded to a specified number. This call forwarding always has priority over other call forwarding you have set.
    * No Answer Forwarding: when you don't pick up, your calls are forwarded to a specified number. You can choose the number of rings before a call is forwarded.
    * Busy Forwarding: when your line is busy, your calls are forwarded to a specified number.
In each of the above cases, you can also choose to forward your calls to your voicemail. If you forward calls to your voicemail, you cannot forward them to a specific number at the same time.  
To turn any of these options on or off in the Webex App: 
    1. Choose the desired option.
    2. Enter the phone number to which you want to forward your calls (e.g. 012123456). If you want to forward calls to your voicemail, do not enter a number. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Simultaneous ringing : Selective Simultaneous Ring ensures that certain phones ring at the same time. You can choose which phone numbers this applies to. If you don't want your employees' phones to start ringing when they're on a call, check Do not ring if on call.
  * Sequential ringing : Selective Sequential Ring ensures that phones ring in a specific order. You can draw up a list with your own order.
  * Remote office : This service allows you to link any number, even if not hosted on our network and all the calls will be forwarded to this destination. Enter a number first. Then To turn this option on or off in the Webex App:   
Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Call waiting : This allows you to take a second call while you're on the line with another caller.   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Block my caller ID : This hides your phone number when you call someone (secret number).   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.

* * *

### Message

With Webex Messaging, connect in real-time or any other time with advanced features for group messaging, file-sharing, whiteboarding, and more.

Send messages 

Learn how to:

  * Read a message
  * Send a message
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Forward messages
  * Get everyone's attention in a space
  * Quotes and threads
  * Format messages
  * Add fun to your messages with emojis
  * Delete messages and files

【30† Send message Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Organize your messages 

Learn how to:

  * Find people, spaces, messages, files and devices
  * Filter your @ mentions
  * Filter important messages
  * Get to your favourite spaces more quickly
  * Filter your spaces and content
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Hide less important spaces
  * Follows conversations more easily with threads

【31† Organize your messages Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share your content 

Learn how to:

  * Share Animated GIFs
  * Share Files with Others
  * Share Your Screen While Messaging
  * Share Files from Microsoft OneDrive or SharePoint Online
  * Share Files from Box
  * Create a Whiteboard in a Space

【32† Share your content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Meet

With Webex Meeting, stay connected with video conferencing that’s engaging, intelligent, and inclusive.

Set up your meeting preferences 

Learn how to: 

  * Change your audio settings
  * Change your video settings
  * Turn off notifications for incoming calls

【33† Set up your meeting preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Join meetings 

Learn how to: 

  * Join a Webex Meeting
  * Join a meeting from your Webex site
  * Register for a Webex Meeting or Event
  * Use a virtual background in the Webex Meetings suite

【34† Join meetings Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Connect to audio and video 

Learn how to: 

  * Mute or unmute other people in a meeting
  * Use a virtual or blurred background in calls and meetings

【35† Connect to audio and video Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share content 

Learn how to: 

  * Share your screen or application in a meeting

【32† Share content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Integrate Webex app to Microsoft Outlook

Improve the collaboration with your contacts by connecting your Microsoft Outlook account to the Webex application.

Connect Microsoft Outlook account to Webex app 

If you use a free Webex account, you can enable the integration in the settings if you are the administrator of your computer. If you use a paid Webex account (Webex for Call Connect, included in your Call Connect license), your administrator must enable the integration for you.

  * View the presence status of your contacts
  * Call your contacts
  * Send your contacts an instant message
  * Shedule and join a Webex meeting

【36† Webex integration to Microsoft Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

【37† Connect your user's Webex App status to Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

parts:
Pour répondre à tes questions concernant **Bizz Call Connect** de Proximus et l'utilisation d'un **SIP Trunk**, voici quelques clarifications basées sur les informations actuelles :

### 1. **SIP Trunk et Bizz Call Connect :**
   - **Bizz Call Connect** est une solution qui te permet de gérer les appels via un numéro principal (comme le numéro de l'asbl) tout en redirigeant les appels vers plusieurs utilisateurs, sur leurs téléphones mobiles ou lignes fixes. Cela fonctionne comme une sorte de **central téléphonique virtuel** hébergé par Proximus.
   - Contrairement à un **SIP Trunk** classique (qui est généralement un service séparé utilisé pour connecter un PBX à l'extérieur), **Bizz Call Connect** est plus simple et est intégré directement dans leur solution cloud. Il te permet d'utiliser des fonctions avancées comme la redirection, les groupes d'appels, et même l'intégration avec **Webex** pour la visioconférence et la gestion des appels【56†source】【58†source】.
   - Donc, **Bizz Call Connect n'est pas exactement un SIP Trunk**, mais il fonctionne comme une alternative plus simple pour les petites entreprises, sans avoir à configurer un système PBX complexe comme 3CX avec un SIP Trunk séparé.

### 2. **Fonctionnalités et coût :**
   - Avec **Bizz Call Connect**, tu peux obtenir toutes les fonctionnalités de gestion des appels via une seule interface, accessible depuis un **portail web** ou l’application **Webex**. Cela inclut la possibilité de rediriger les appels vers les mobiles des employés, de transférer des appels, d'utiliser des files d'attente, et bien plus encore.
   - En termes de coût, ta collègue a raison : **Proximus facture environ 20 à 25 €/mois** pour cette solution, quel que soit le nombre d'utilisateurs, ce qui peut être beaucoup plus économique qu'un SIP Trunk traditionnel【56†source】【57†source】.

### 3. **Webex vs 3CX :**
   - **Webex**, fourni avec Bizz Call Connect, est essentiellement une plateforme de collaboration qui inclut des fonctionnalités d'appel, de messagerie et de visioconférence. Cela permet une gestion des appels similaire à 3CX, mais intégrée directement avec l'infrastructure de Proximus. **Webex** n'est pas un PBX comme 3CX, mais plutôt une solution unifiée qui combine téléphonie et collaboration【57†source】【59†source】.
   - **3CX**, quant à lui, est un **système PBX** complet que tu dois gérer toi-même, souvent avec un **SIP Trunk** pour passer des appels externes. **Webex** est plus une solution prête à l'emploi pour les petites entreprises, tandis que **3CX** offre plus de flexibilité et de personnalisation si tu veux avoir un contrôle total.

En résumé, **Bizz Call Connect** avec **Webex** est une solution pratique qui peut te permettre de gérer les appels de ton asbl sans avoir à configurer un **SIP Trunk** avec 3CX. C'est une alternative plus simple et potentiellement moins coûteuse pour tes besoins.

* Stay reachable, even while on the go
  * Make unlimited calls*

【28† Talk to an expert 】 

## Manage your business calls as you wish

[Image 0] 

Simultaneous calls

Your team can make and receive unlimited calls* through a landline number, all while having personal numbers.

[Image 1] 

Transfer, Forwarding, and Voicemail

You're in control. Redirect calls to another landline, a mobile, or your voicemail.

[Image 2] 

Professional greeting

Provide a tailored experience with a welcoming message, interactive menu, waiting music...

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange
  * Easy management through a web portal or mobile app
  * Flexibility: add or remove users very easily

* * *

#### Not a packs customer yet?

If you want to benefit from the Bizz Call Connect option, compose your Business pack

€25/month

Secured payment

Close the overlayer 

## Why buy online

### Non-binding subscription

  * Modify or cancel whenever you want
  * For free

* * *

### 100% secure payment

  * Choose between several payment methods:  
[Image 3: Visa] [Image 4: Mastercard] [Image 5: Bancontact] [Image 6: Maestro]
  * Possibility for (bi)-monthly invoice depending of ordered online product

* * *

【30†Do you need the aftersale service?】

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary’s landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from €25 /month + free installation

【31†Request a quote】 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

【32† Discover the phones Opens a new window 】 

 Conditions 

  * 【33† General conditions 】 
  * 【34† Promotion conditions 】 

The 【35†Terms and Conditions】 and 【36†Pricelist & tariffs】 apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the « Bizz Switch » product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to   Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of € 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

metadata.title: Bizz Call Connect - manage your company's calls | Proximus
metadata.text:
* Stay reachable, even while on the go
  * Make unlimited calls*

【28† Talk to an expert 】 

## Manage your business calls as you wish

[Image 0] 

Simultaneous calls

Your team can make and receive unlimited calls* through a landline number, all while having personal numbers.

[Image 1] 

Transfer, Forwarding, and Voicemail

You're in control. Redirect calls to another landline, a mobile, or your voicemail.

[Image 2] 

Professional greeting

Provide a tailored experience with a welcoming message, interactive menu, waiting music...

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange
  * Easy management through a web portal or mobile app
  * Flexibility: add or remove users very easily

* * *

#### Not a packs customer yet?

If you want to benefit from the Bizz Call Connect option, compose your Business pack

* * *

Option for Business Pack starting from

€25/month

【29†Request a quote】

Non binding subscription

Secured payment

Close the overlayer 

## Why buy online

### Non-binding subscription

  * Modify or cancel whenever you want
  * For free

* * *

### 100% secure payment

  * Choose between several payment methods:  
[Image 3: Visa] [Image 4: Mastercard] [Image 5: Bancontact] [Image 6: Maestro]
  * Possibility for (bi)-monthly invoice depending of ordered online product

* * *

【30†Do you need the aftersale service?】

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary’s landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from €25 /month + free installation

【31†Request a quote】 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

【32† Discover the phones Opens a new window 】 

 Conditions 

  * 【33† General conditions 】 
  * 【34† Promotion conditions 】 

The 【35†Terms and Conditions】 and 【36†Pricelist & tariffs】 apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the « Bizz Switch » product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to   Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of € 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

Close the overlayer

With the Webex app, you can not only handle your landline calls on your smartphone, but also improve your workflows and stay connected thanks to a complete suite of team collaboration features (calls, voicemail, meetings and integration).

metadata.title: Use the Webex app for Call Connect | Proximus
metadata.text:
* Answer a call
  * Call someone in your organization

【32† Call people Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Advanced calling options 

Don't use native call settings in the Webex App. Proximus implemented dedicated advanced calls settings within the Webex App to allow automatic synchronisation  with the Call Connect Portal.  
To go to this section, follow these steps: 

  1. Click on your initials on the top left side of the screen.  
[Image 0]
  2. Click on Settings  
[Image 1]
  3. Click on Calling  
[Image 2]
  4. Click on Advanced call settings  
[Image 3]

Now you can learn how to:

  * Do not disturb : This activates automatic call forwarding to your voice mail, if it's activated. If voice mail isn't activated, your caller will hear a busy tone. To turn this option on or off in the Webex App. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Call Forwarding : There are different types of Call Forwarding: 
    * Always Forwarding: all your calls are forwarded to a specified number. This call forwarding always has priority over other call forwarding you have set.
    * No Answer Forwarding: when you don't pick up, your calls are forwarded to a specified number. You can choose the number of rings before a call is forwarded.
    * Busy Forwarding: when your line is busy, your calls are forwarded to a specified number.
In each of the above cases, you can also choose to forward your calls to your voicemail. If you forward calls to your voicemail, you cannot forward them to a specific number at the same time.  
To turn any of these options on or off in the Webex App: 
    1. Choose the desired option.
    2. Enter the phone number to which you want to forward your calls (e.g. 012123456). If you want to forward calls to your voicemail, do not enter a number. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Simultaneous ringing : Selective Simultaneous Ring ensures that certain phones ring at the same time. You can choose which phone numbers this applies to. If you don't want your employees' phones to start ringing when they're on a call, check Do not ring if on call.
  * Sequential ringing : Selective Sequential Ring ensures that phones ring in a specific order. You can draw up a list with your own order.
  * Remote office : This service allows you to link any number, even if not hosted on our network and all the calls will be forwarded to this destination. Enter a number first. Then To turn this option on or off in the Webex App:   
Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Call waiting : This allows you to take a second call while you're on the line with another caller.   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Block my caller ID : This hides your phone number when you call someone (secret number).   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.

* * *

### Message

With Webex Messaging, connect in real-time or any other time with advanced features for group messaging, file-sharing, whiteboarding, and more.

Send messages 

Learn how to:

  * Read a message
  * Send a message
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Forward messages
  * Get everyone's attention in a space
  * Quotes and threads
  * Format messages
  * Add fun to your messages with emojis
  * Delete messages and files

【33† Send message Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Organize your messages 

Learn how to:

  * Find people, spaces, messages, files and devices
  * Filter your @ mentions
  * Filter important messages
  * Get to your favourite spaces more quickly
  * Filter your spaces and content
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Hide less important spaces
  * Follows conversations more easily with threads

【34† Organize your messages Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share your content 

Learn how to:

  * Share Animated GIFs
  * Share Files with Others
  * Share Your Screen While Messaging
  * Share Files from Microsoft OneDrive or SharePoint Online
  * Share Files from Box
  * Create a Whiteboard in a Space

【35† Share your content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Meet

With Webex Meeting, stay connected with video conferencing that’s engaging, intelligent, and inclusive.

Set up your meeting preferences 

Learn how to: 

  * Change your audio settings
  * Change your video settings
  * Turn off notifications for incoming calls

【36† Set up your meeting preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Join meetings 

Learn how to: 

  * Join a Webex Meeting
  * Join a meeting from your Webex site
  * Register for a Webex Meeting or Event
  * Use a virtual background in the Webex Meetings suite

【37† Join meetings Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Schedule meetings 

Learn how to: 

  * Start a personal Room meeting
  * Start a meeting from a  space
  * Schedule a meeting from a space
  * Schedule a meeting using @webex or @meet

【38† Schedule meetings Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Connect to audio and video 

Learn how to: 

  * Mute or unmute other people in a meeting
  * Use a virtual or blurred background in calls and meetings

【39† Connect to audio and video Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share content 

Learn how to: 

  * Share your screen or application in a meeting

【35† Share content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Integrate Webex app to Microsoft Outlook

Improve the collaboration with your contacts by connecting your Microsoft Outlook account to the Webex application.

Connect Microsoft Outlook account to Webex app 

If you use a free Webex account, you can enable the integration in the settings if you are the administrator of your computer. If you use a paid Webex account (Webex for Call Connect, included in your Call Connect license), your administrator must enable the integration for you.

  * View the presence status of your contacts
  * Call your contacts
  * Send your contacts an instant message
  * Shedule and join a Webex meeting

【40† Webex integration to Microsoft Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

【41† Connect your user's Webex App status to Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

## 

★ ★ ★ ★ ★

###  Contact us 

####  Our employees are ready to help you! 

  * Call us on 【42†0800 55 200†tel:+3280055200】  
Administrative questions : Monday - Friday (from 8 a.m. until 6.30 p.m.)  
T

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary’s landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from €25 /month + free installation

【31†Request a quote】

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8]

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the « Bizz Switch » product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to   Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of € 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

content_references.title: Use the Webex app for Call Connect | Proximus
content_references.snippet:
* Answer a call
  * Call someone in your organization

【32† Call people Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Advanced calling options 

Don't use native call settings in the Webex App. Proximus implemented dedicated advanced calls settings within the Webex App to allow automatic synchronisation  with the Call Connect Portal.  
To go to this section, follow these steps: 

  1. Click on your initials on the top left side of the screen.  
[Image 0]
  2. Click on Settings  
[Image 1]
  3. Click on Calling  
[Image 2]
  4. Click on Advanced call settings  
[Image 3]

Now you can learn how to:

  * Do not disturb : This activates automatic call forwarding to your voice mail, if it's activated. If voice mail isn't activated, your caller will hear a busy tone. To turn this option on or off in the Webex App. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Call Forwarding : There are different types of Call Forwarding: 
    * Always Forwarding: all your calls are forwarded to a specified number. This call forwarding always has priority over other call forwarding you have set.
    * No Answer Forwarding: when you don't pick up, your calls are forwarded to a specified number. You can choose the number of rings before a call is forwarded.
    * Busy Forwarding: when your line is busy, your calls are forwarded to a specified number.
In each of the above cases, you can also choose to forward your calls to your voicemail. If you forward calls to your voicemail, you cannot forward them to a specific number at the same time.  
To turn any of these options on or off in the Webex App: 
    1. Choose the desired option.
    2. Enter the phone number to which you want to forward your calls (e.g. 012123456). If you want to forward calls to your voicemail, do not enter a number. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Simultaneous ringing : Selective Simultaneous Ring ensures that certain phones ring at the same time. You can choose which phone numbers this applies to. If you don't want your employees' phones to start ringing when they're on a call, check Do not ring if on call.
  * Sequential ringing : Selective Sequential Ring ensures that phones ring in a specific order. You can draw up a list with your own order.
  * Remote office : This service allows you to link any number, even if not hosted on our network and all the calls will be forwarded to this destination. Enter a number first. Then To turn this option on or off in the Webex App:   
Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Call waiting : This allows you to take a second call while you're on the line with another caller.   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Block my caller ID : This hides your phone number when you call someone (secret number).   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.

* * *

### Message

With Webex Messaging, connect in real-time or any other time with advanced features for group messaging, file-sharing, whiteboarding, and more.

Send messages 

Learn how to:

  * Read a message
  * Send a message
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Forward messages
  * Get everyone's attention in a space
  * Quotes and threads
  * Format messages
  * Add fun to your messages with emojis
  * Delete messages and files

【33† Send message Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Organize your messages 

Learn how to:

  * Find people, spaces, messages, files and devices
  * Filter your @ mentions
  * Filter important messages
  * Get to your favourite spaces more quickly
  * Filter your spaces and content
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Hide less important spaces
  * Follows conversations more easily with threads

【34† Organize your messages Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share your content 

Learn how to:

  * Share Animated GIFs
  * Share Files with Others
  * Share Your Screen While Messaging
  * Share Files from Microsoft OneDrive or SharePoint Online
  * Share Files from Box
  * Create a Whiteboard in a Space

【35† Share your content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Meet

With Webex Meeting, stay connected with video conferencing that’s engaging, intelligent, and inclusive.

Set up your meeting preferences 

Learn how to: 

  * Change your audio settings
  * Change your video settings
  * Turn off notifications for incoming calls

【36† Set up your meeting preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Join meetings 

Learn how to: 

  * Join a Webex Meeting
  * Join a meeting from your Webex site
  * Register for a Webex Meeting or Event
  * Use a virtual background in the Webex Meetings suite

【37† Join meetings Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Schedule meetings 

Learn how to: 

  * Start a personal Room meeting
  * Start a meeting from a  space
  * Schedule a meeting from a space
  * Schedule a meeting using @webex or @meet

【38† Schedule meetings Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Connect to audio and video 

Learn how to: 

  * Mute or unmute other people in a meeting
  * Use a virtual or blurred background in calls and meetings

【39† Connect to audio and video Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share content 

Learn how to: 

  * Share your screen or application in a meeting

【35† Share content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Integrate Webex app to Microsoft Outlook

Improve the collaboration with your contacts by connecting your Microsoft Outlook account to the Webex application.

Connect Microsoft Outlook account to Webex app 

If you use a free Webex account, you can enable the integration in the settings if you are the administrator of your computer. If you use a paid Webex account (Webex for Call Connect, included in your Call Connect license), your administrator must enable the integration for you.

  * View the presence status of your contacts
  * Call your contacts
  * Send your contacts an instant message
  * Shedule and join a Webex meeting

【40† Webex integration to Microsoft Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

【41† Connect your user's Webex App status to Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

## 

★ ★ ★ ★ ★

###  Contact us 

####  Our employees are ready to help you! 

  * Call us on 【42†0800 55 200†tel:+3280055200】  
Administrative questions : Monday - Friday (from 8 a.m. until 6.30 p.m.)  
T

content_references.title: Use the Webex app for Call Connect | Proximus
content_references.snippet:
【28† Set up calling preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Call people 

Learn how to: 

  * Make audio and video calls 
  * Answer a call
  * Call someone in your organization

【29† Call people Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Advanced calling options 

Don't use native call settings in the Webex App. Proximus implemented dedicated advanced calls settings within the Webex App to allow automatic synchronisation  with the Call Connect Portal.  
To go to this section, follow these steps: 

  1. Tap your initials on the top left side of the screen.  
[Image 0]
  2. Tap Settings  
[Image 1]
  3. Tap Calling  
[Image 2]
  4. Tap Advanced call settings  
[Image 3]

Now you can learn how to:

  * Do not disturb : This activates automatic call forwarding to your voice mail, if it's activated. If voice mail isn't activated, your caller will hear a busy tone. To turn this option on or off in the Webex App. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Call Forwarding : There are different types of Call Forwarding: 
    * Always Forwarding: all your calls are forwarded to a specified number. This call forwarding always has priority over other call forwarding you have set.
    * No Answer Forwarding: when you don't pick up, your calls are forwarded to a specified number. You can choose the number of rings before a call is forwarded.
    * Busy Forwarding: when your line is busy, your calls are forwarded to a specified number.
In each of the above cases, you can also choose to forward your calls to your voicemail. If you forward calls to your voicemail, you cannot forward them to a specific number at the same time.  
To turn any of these options on or off in the Webex App: 
    1. Choose the desired option.
    2. Enter the phone number to which you want to forward your calls (e.g. 012123456). If you want to forward calls to your voicemail, do not enter a number. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Simultaneous ringing : Selective Simultaneous Ring ensures that certain phones ring at the same time. You can choose which phone numbers this applies to. If you don't want your employees' phones to start ringing when they're on a call, check Do not ring if on call.
  * Sequential ringing : Selective Sequential Ring ensures that phones ring in a specific order. You can draw up a list with your own order.
  * Remote office : This service allows you to link any number, even if not hosted on our network and all the calls will be forwarded to this destination. Enter a number first. Then To turn this option on or off in the Webex App:   
Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Call waiting : This allows you to take a second call while you're on the line with another caller.   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Block my caller ID : This hides your phone number when you call someone (secret number).   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.

* * *

### Message

With Webex Messaging, connect in real-time or any other time with advanced features for group messaging, file-sharing, whiteboarding, and more.

  * Filter your spaces and content
  * Get back to your drafts

parts:
Ok, et comme a priori tu n'as pas trouver d'informations concernant la possibilité en tant que client Business d'avoir juste un trunk SIP chez Proximus, qui aurait pu être moins cher ?!

Et que dans l'optique d'avoir rapidement un système simple pour les collègues qui ne maitrise pas l'ICT, et qui ne trouveront pas aussi stimulant que moi de devoir découvrir et paramétrer 3CX. Tu pense que la solution package de Proximus Biz Call Connect + Webex est la plus sensée ?

Il semble que Proximus ne mette pas en avant d'offres spécifiques pour un **SIP Trunk seul** pour ses clients Business, en dehors de solutions packagées comme **Bizz Call Connect**. D'après mes recherches, la plupart des solutions disponibles chez Proximus sont orientées vers des offres complètes qui incluent la gestion des appels avec des fonctionnalités avancées, telles que celles proposées par **Bizz Call Connect**.

### Concernant la solution **Bizz Call Connect + Webex** :

Cette solution pourrait effectivement être la plus **sensée** pour tes besoins et ceux de ton équipe, pour plusieurs raisons :

1. **Facilité d'utilisation** : Tes collègues n'auront pas besoin de maîtriser l'ICT ou de configurer des systèmes complexes comme **3CX**. L'interface de **Bizz Call Connect** via le portail web et l'application **Webex** est conçue pour être conviviale et simple à utiliser【56†source】【57†source】.

2. **Coût** : À environ **20 à 25 €/mois** pour un nombre illimité d'utilisateurs, c'est une solution économique comparée à un setup plus complexe avec **3CX** et un **SIP Trunk**. En choisissant cette option, tu économises sur les coûts supplémentaires liés à la gestion d'une infrastructure PBX sur mesure【56†source】.

3. **Fonctionnalités incluses** : La solution intègre plusieurs fonctionnalités utiles telles que la gestion des appels, le transfert, les messages vocaux, la redirection des appels, et la collaboration via **Webex** (visioconférences, messagerie instantanée, etc.). Tout cela est géré à partir d'une seule plateforme, ce qui simplifie grandement la gestion pour tes collègues【58†source】【59†source】.

### Conclusion :
Pour un **système simple et rapidement opérationnel**, avec un coût maîtrisé et une facilité d'utilisation pour tes collègues, la solution **Bizz Call Connect + Webex** semble être la meilleure option. Elle t'évite les tracas techniques liés à l'installation et à la configuration d'un système PBX comme **3CX**, tout en offrant les fonctionnalités nécessaires pour une petite équipe.

* Stay reachable, even while on the go

【28† Talk to an expert 】 

## Manage your business calls as you wish

[Image 0] 

Simultaneous calls

Your team can make and receive unlimited calls* through a landline number, all while having personal numbers.

[Image 1] 

Transfer, Forwarding, and Voicemail

You're in control. Redirect calls to another landline, a mobile, or your voicemail.

[Image 2] 

Professional greeting

Provide a tailored experience with a welcoming message, interactive menu, waiting music...

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange
  * Easy management through a web portal or mobile app
  * Flexibility: add or remove users very easily

* * *

#### Not a packs customer yet?

If you want to benefit from the Bizz Call Connect option, compose your Business pack

* * *

€25/month

Close the overlayer 

## Why buy online

  * Modify or cancel whenever you want
  * For free

* * *

### 100% secure payment

  * Choose between several payment methods:  
[Image 3: Visa] [Image 4: Mastercard] [Image 5: Bancontact] [Image 6: Maestro]
  * Possibility for (bi)-monthly invoice depending of ordered online product

* * *

【30†Do you need the aftersale service?】

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary’s landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from €25 /month + free installation

【31†Request a quote】 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

【32† Discover the phones Opens a new window 】 

 Conditions 

  * 【33† General conditions 】 
  * 【34† Promotion conditions 】 

The 【35†Terms and Conditions】 and 【36†Pricelist & tariffs】 apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the « Bizz Switch » product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to   Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of € 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

Close the overlayer

##  

With the Webex app, you can not only handle your landline calls on your smartphone, but also improve your workflows and stay connected thanks to a complete suite of team collaboration features (calls, voicemail, meetings and integration).

metadata.title: Use the Webex app for Call Connect | Proximus
metadata.text:
【28† Set up calling preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Call people 

Learn how to: 

  * Make audio and video calls 
  * Answer a call
  * Call someone in your organization

【29† Call people Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Advanced calling options 

Don't use native call settings in the Webex App. Proximus implemented dedicated advanced calls settings within the Webex App to allow automatic synchronisation  with the Call Connect Portal.  
To go to this section, follow these steps: 

  1. Tap your initials on the top left side of the screen.  
[Image 0]
  2. Tap Settings  
[Image 1]
  3. Tap Calling  
[Image 2]
  4. Tap Advanced call settings  
[Image 3]

Now you can learn how to:

  * Do not disturb : This activates automatic call forwarding to your voice mail, if it's activated. If voice mail isn't activated, your caller will hear a busy tone. To turn this option on or off in the Webex App. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Call Forwarding : There are different types of Call Forwarding: 
    * Always Forwarding: all your calls are forwarded to a specified number. This call forwarding always has priority over other call forwarding you have set.
    * No Answer Forwarding: when you don't pick up, your calls are forwarded to a specified number. You can choose the number of rings before a call is forwarded.
    * Busy Forwarding: when your line is busy, your calls are forwarded to a specified number.
In each of the above cases, you can also choose to forward your calls to your voicemail. If you forward calls to your voicemail, you cannot forward them to a specific number at the same time.  
To turn any of these options on or off in the Webex App: 
    1. Choose the desired option.
    2. Enter the phone number to which you want to forward your calls (e.g. 012123456). If you want to forward calls to your voicemail, do not enter a number. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Simultaneous ringing : Selective Simultaneous Ring ensures that certain phones ring at the same time. You can choose which phone numbers this applies to. If you don't want your employees' phones to start ringing when they're on a call, check Do not ring if on call.
  * Sequential ringing : Selective Sequential Ring ensures that phones ring in a specific order. You can draw up a list with your own order.
  * Remote office : This service allows you to link any number, even if not hosted on our network and all the calls will be forwarded to this destination. Enter a number first. Then To turn this option on or off in the Webex App:   
Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Call waiting : This allows you to take a second call while you're on the line with another caller.   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Block my caller ID : This hides your phone number when you call someone (secret number).   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.

* * *

### Message

With Webex Messaging, connect in real-time or any other time with advanced features for group messaging, file-sharing, whiteboarding, and more.

Send messages 

Learn how to:

  * Read a message
  * Send a message
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Forward messages
  * Get everyone's attention in a space
  * Quotes and threads
  * Format messages
  * Add fun to your messages with emojis
  * Delete messages and files

【30† Send message Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Organize your messages 

Learn how to:

  * Find people, spaces, messages, files and devices
  * Filter your @ mentions
  * Filter important messages
  * Get to your favourite spaces more quickly
  * Filter your spaces and content
  * Get back to your drafts
  * Hide less important spaces
  * Follows conversations more easily with threads

【31† Organize your messages Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share your content 

Learn how to:

  * Share Animated GIFs
  * Share Files with Others
  * Share Your Screen While Messaging
  * Share Files from Microsoft OneDrive or SharePoint Online
  * Share Files from Box
  * Create a Whiteboard in a Space

【32† Share your content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Meet

With Webex Meeting, stay connected with video conferencing that’s engaging, intelligent, and inclusive.

Set up your meeting preferences 

Learn how to: 

  * Change your audio settings
  * Change your video settings
  * Turn off notifications for incoming calls

【33† Set up your meeting preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Join meetings 

Learn how to: 

  * Join a Webex Meeting
  * Join a meeting from your Webex site
  * Register for a Webex Meeting or Event
  * Use a virtual background in the Webex Meetings suite

【34† Join meetings Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Connect to audio and video 

Learn how to: 

  * Mute or unmute other people in a meeting
  * Use a virtual or blurred background in calls and meetings

【35† Connect to audio and video Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Share content 

Learn how to: 

  * Share your screen or application in a meeting

【32† Share content Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

### Integrate Webex app to Microsoft Outlook

Improve the collaboration with your contacts by connecting your Microsoft Outlook account to the Webex application.

Connect Microsoft Outlook account to Webex app 

If you use a free Webex account, you can enable the integration in the settings if you are the administrator of your computer. If you use a paid Webex account (Webex for Call Connect, included in your Call Connect license), your administrator must enable the integration for you.

  * View the presence status of your contacts
  * Call your contacts
  * Send your contacts an instant message
  * Shedule and join a Webex meeting

【36† Webex integration to Microsoft Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

【37† Connect your user's Webex App status to Outlook Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

* * *

## 

★ ★ ★ ★ ★

###  Contact 

####  Our Bizz Experts are at your disposal. Choose your contact mode. 

>Close

## Contact

### Our Bizz Experts are at your disposal. Choose your contact mode.

content_references.snippet:
* Stay reachable, even while on the go
  * Make unlimited calls*

【28† Talk to an expert 】 

## Manage your business calls as you wish

[Image 0] 

Simultaneous calls

Your team can make and receive unlimited calls* through a landline number, all while having personal numbers.

[Image 1] 

Transfer, Forwarding, and Voicemail

You're in control. Redirect calls to another landline, a mobile, or your voicemail.

[Image 2] 

Professional greeting

Provide a tailored experience with a welcoming message, interactive menu, waiting music...

## The smart system for handling your business calls

#### With Bizz Call Connect, you won't miss any call

  * From your employees' landlines and mobile devices
  * Access all the functionalities of a telephone exchange
  * Easy management through a web portal or mobile app
  * Flexibility: add or remove users very easily

* * *

#### Not a packs customer yet?

If you want to benefit from the Bizz Call Connect option, compose your Business pack

* * *

Option for Business Pack starting from

€25/month

【29†Request a quote】

Non binding subscription

Secured payment

Close the overlayer 

## Why buy online

### Non-binding subscription

  * Modify or cancel whenever you want
  * For free

* * *

### 100% secure payment

  * Choose between several payment methods:  
[Image 3: Visa] [Image 4: Mastercard] [Image 5: Bancontact] [Image 6: Maestro]
  * Possibility for (bi)-monthly invoice depending of ordered online product

* * *

【30†Do you need the aftersale service?】

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

 See more See less

#### How does Bizz Call Connect work?

An example: Peter and Mary are architects and share the same office.

They have a general number which they give out to their customers and use in their communication (business card, website, advertising, etc.). If a customer dials this number, the call will simultaneously arrive on both Peter and Mary’s landline. If they are on a construction site, the call will be diverted to their mobile phone.

On the construction site when Mary and Peter call a customer from their mobile, it's the landline number that will be displayed. In this way, their mobile phone numbers remain private.

On Tuesdays, Mary is always in the office.

To avoid disturbing Peter, all calls arrive on Mary's landline phone only.

Outside office hours, a welcome message is played back to customers. They can leave any messages on an answering machine.

[Image 7]

Bizz Call Connect

As from €25 /month + free installation

【31†Request a quote】 

## How does the installation work?

### Free installation

A technician will call in at no charge to install the Bizz Call Connect solution and the associated equipment. He will take care of the basic setup and help you familiarize with the phones, the app and the portal.

[Image 8] 

#### Limit your investments and rent IP phones

You don't have to invest in hardware. You can rent IP phones from Proximus.

【32† Discover the phones Opens a new window 】 

 Conditions 

  * 【33† General conditions 】 
  * 【34† Promotion conditions 】 

The 【35†Terms and Conditions】 and 【36†Pricelist & tariffs】 apply.

A Proximus VDSL2 Internet line is required to use Bizz Call Connect.  
*Unlimited national calls with Business Flex : *Unlimited national calls to landline numbers and 1,000 minutes per month to mobile numbers, valid from one fixed number.  
If you call for more than 1,000 minutes, you pay a special rate. Calls 24/7, except to special numbers (voting, 0900, etc.).  
*Unlimited international calls: from your landline, 1,000 minutes for calling landline and mobile numbers in 37 countries (Andorra, Bulgaria, Canada, Cyprus, Denmark, Germany, Estonia, Faroe Islands, Finland, France, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Iceland, Italy, Croatia, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco, Netherlands, Norway, Austria, Poland, Portugal, Romania, San Marino, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Czech Republic, United Kingdom, United States, Sweden, and Switzerland). Only to landline numbers in Morocco and Turkey. If you exceed the 1,000 minutes or call other countries, you pay a special rate of -50% instead of the standard rate (Classic).

If you opt for a Business Flex plan, the « Bizz Switch » product is automatically removed from your pack as all its features are included in Bizz Call Connect. When a Bizz Call Connect solution or Multi Line is added to   Business Flex , the included traditional telephone line (PSTN) will be automatically replaced by an IP line. NB: some alarms are not compatible with the IP line. Please contact your vendor for more information.

Promo Free installation (instead of € 350) valid from 01 July 2019 to 31 December 2024 for the installation and configuration costs of the licenses and for travel costs, but does not include the cost of installing options, extra indoor cabling, any specific on-site work required, and the cost of installing the lines and Internet.

Close the overlayer

##  

With the Webex app, you can not only handle your landline calls on your smartphone, but also improve your workflows and stay connected thanks to a complete suite of team collaboration features (calls, voicemail, meetings and integration).

【28† Set up calling preferences Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Call people 

Learn how to: 

  * Make audio and video calls 
  * Answer a call
  * Call someone in your organization

【29† Call people Opens a new window †help.webex.com】 

Advanced calling options 

Don't use native call settings in the Webex App. Proximus implemented dedicated advanced calls settings within the Webex App to allow automatic synchronisation  with the Call Connect Portal.  
To go to this section, follow these steps: 

  1. Tap your initials on the top left side of the screen.  
[Image 0]
  2. Tap Settings  
[Image 1]
  3. Tap Calling  
[Image 2]
  4. Tap Advanced call settings  
[Image 3]

Now you can learn how to:

  * Do not disturb : This activates automatic call forwarding to your voice mail, if it's activated. If voice mail isn't activated, your caller will hear a busy tone. To turn this option on or off in the Webex App. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Call Forwarding : There are different types of Call Forwarding: 
    * Always Forwarding: all your calls are forwarded to a specified number. This call forwarding always has priority over other call forwarding you have set.
    * No Answer Forwarding: when you don't pick up, your calls are forwarded to a specified number. You can choose the number of rings before a call is forwarded.
    * Busy Forwarding: when your line is busy, your calls are forwarded to a specified number.
In each of the above cases, you can also choose to forward your calls to your voicemail. If you forward calls to your voicemail, you cannot forward them to a specific number at the same time.  
To turn any of these options on or off in the Webex App: 
    1. Choose the desired option.
    2. Enter the phone number to which you want to forward your calls (e.g. 012123456). If you want to forward calls to your voicemail, do not enter a number. Your choice is automatically saved.
  * Simultaneous ringing : Selective Simultaneous Ring ensures that certain phones ring at the same time. You can choose which phone numbers this applies to. If you don't want your employees' phones to start ringing when they're on a call, check Do not ring if on call.
  * Sequential ringing : Selective Sequential Ring ensures that phones ring in a specific order. You can draw up a list with your own order.
  * Remote office : This service allows you to link any number, even if not hosted on our network and all the calls will be forwarded to this destination. Enter a number first. Then To turn this option on or off in the Webex App:   
Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Call waiting : This allows you to take a second call while you're on the line with another caller.   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.
  * Block my caller ID : This hides your phone number when you call someone (secret number).   
To turn this option on or off in the Webex App: Check or uncheck Active to turn the option on or off.

parts:
Ok donc ma collègue avait, in fine, une bonne intuition sur la pertinence de creuser cette piste d'offre chez Proximus.
Juste pour terminer. Si à l'avenir nous souhaitions quand même utiliser des solutions auto-hébergées et moins cher voir gratuite. Existe-t-il d'autre FAI que Proximus plus adapté à ce genre de demande particulière et/ou particulièrement adaptée aux asbl fan de solutions open-source alternatives ?

Oui, ta collègue avait effectivement une bonne intuition avec **Bizz Call Connect** de Proximus, car cela répond bien aux besoins immédiats sans la complexité technique d'un système auto-hébergé.

### Alternatives pour l'avenir :

Si tu envisages de migrer vers des solutions **auto-hébergées** ou des alternatives plus économiques à l'avenir, voici quelques suggestions de **fournisseurs d'accès internet (FAI)** en Belgique qui pourraient être plus flexibles et ouverts aux solutions open-source, notamment pour les asbl et les structures à but non lucratif :

1. **EDPnet** :
   - **EDPnet** est une alternative intéressante à Proximus, souvent moins chère. Ce FAI est reconnu pour son approche plus technique et sa flexibilité avec des services comme les **SIP Trunks** et des solutions plus adaptées aux besoins open-source.
   - Ils proposent des **trunks SIP** à des prix compétitifs pour les appels via VoIP, et sont souvent utilisés par des entreprises ou associations qui cherchent à mettre en place leurs propres systèmes PBX.
   
2. **OVHcloud** :
   - OVH est un acteur majeur en matière d'hébergement et de téléphonie VoIP. Ils proposent des **SIP Trunks**, des solutions de téléphonie cloud, ainsi que des services d'hébergement de serveurs. Ils sont très populaires auprès des **asbl** et des utilisateurs de solutions **open-source**.
   - Si tu souhaites héberger toi-même des solutions comme **3CX** ou d'autres systèmes PBX basés sur Asterisk, OVHcloud est une option très adaptée avec un bon support technique et des prix compétitifs.

3. **Scarlet** (filiale de Proximus) :
   - Scarlet est souvent une option plus économique par rapport à Proximus, même s’ils appartiennent au même groupe. Ils peuvent offrir des solutions internet moins chères tout en ayant accès à une bonne infrastructure. Ils ne se spécialisent pas dans les solutions open-source, mais leur tarification abordable pourrait te permettre d’utiliser un **SIP Trunk** tiers avec des solutions auto-hébergées comme 3CX ou FreePBX.

4. **Nethys/Voo** :
   - Si tu es situé dans une région couverte par Voo, ils pourraient être une alternative intéressante. Bien qu'ils ne soient pas spécifiquement orientés open-source, tu pourrais envisager de souscrire à leurs offres internet tout en utilisant un fournisseur de SIP indépendant comme OVH.

### Conclusion :
- Si tu optes pour une solution **auto-hébergée**, des fournisseurs comme **EDPnet** ou **OVHcloud** sont parmi les meilleurs choix en Belgique pour les asbl et les amateurs de solutions open-source.
- **Proximus** reste une bonne option pour des solutions prêtes à l'emploi comme Bizz Call Connect, mais si tu cherches à réduire les coûts avec des solutions personnalisées à l'avenir, ces autres FAI offrent une flexibilité et un support technique adapté à ce type de configuration.

N'hésite pas à explorer ces options en fonction de l'évolution de tes besoins !

parts: Comment définir un format numéro de téléphone pour une colonne dans Excel ?

Pour définir un format de numéro de téléphone dans une colonne dans Excel, tu peux suivre ces étapes :

1. **Sélectionne la colonne ou les cellules** où tu souhaites appliquer le format de numéro de téléphone.
2. Fais un clic droit sur la sélection et choisis **"Format de cellule"** ou utilise le raccourci clavier `Ctrl + 1`.
3. Dans la fenêtre **"Format de cellule"**, va dans l'onglet **"Nombre"**.
4. Sélectionne **"Personnalisée"** dans la liste de gauche.
5. Dans le champ **"Type"**, entre un format personnalisé selon le modèle de ton numéro de téléphone. Par exemple :
   - Pour un numéro de téléphone au format classique français, entre `00 00 00 00 00` ou `00-00-00-00-00`.
   - Si tu veux un format avec un indicatif, tu peux utiliser `+33 0# ## ## ## ##`.

Voici quelques exemples de formats de téléphone :
- Pour un format français : `00 00 00 00 00`
- Pour un format américain : `(###) ###-####`

6. Clique sur **OK** pour appliquer le format.

Ton numéro de téléphone sera maintenant formaté selon le style que tu as défini, mais les valeurs sous-jacentes resteront des nombres, ce qui est utile pour éviter les erreurs de calcul ou de tri.

Si tu utilises des numéros internationaux avec des indicatifs, tu peux adapter les espaces et parenthèses dans la personnalisation.

Est-ce que ce format convient pour tes besoins ?
En fait, je ne sais pas si c'est possible mais je souhaiterai que les numéros de GSM s'affiche comme ceci : 0485/56.86.11  Comment faire ? Que dois-je mettre dans Type ?
Sébastien souhaite que les numéros de GSM dans Excel s'affichent au format : 0485/56.86.11.
Model set context updated.

Pour obtenir le format de numéro de téléphone comme celui-ci : **0485/56.86.11**, tu peux utiliser ce format personnalisé dans Excel.

Voici comment le faire :

1. **Sélectionne la colonne ou les cellules** où tu souhaites appliquer le format.
2. Fais un clic droit et choisis **"Format de cellule"** ou utilise le raccourci `Ctrl + 1`.
3. Dans l'onglet **"Nombre"**, sélectionne **"Personnalisée"**.
4. Dans la zone **"Type"**, entre le format suivant :

   ```
   0000"/"00"."00"."00
   ```

5. Clique sur **OK**.

Ainsi, les numéros que tu entrerais, comme `0485568611`, s'afficheront sous la forme `0485/56.86.11`.

Essaie cela, et dis-moi si ça correspond à ce que tu cherchais !

Je suis occupé a créer une liste des coordonnées des parents et des élèves de la nouvelle école secondaire de ma fille Violette. C'est l'école Eole et je suis un des parents qui essaye d'initier une association des parents.
Bref, comme tu le vois sur les 2 captures d'écrans je souhaiterai que le parent 2 puisse entrer une autre adresse si les parents sont divorcés. Mais par défaut je souhaiterai que il y ai un choix (via une liste ou un bouton) qui permette d'indiquer "Idem que P1" si c'est la même adresse.  Tu crois qu'il est possible de faire cela ?

Sébastien est en train de créer une liste des coordonnées des parents et des élèves de l'école secondaire de sa fille Violette, qui est l'école Eole. Il fait partie des parents qui essayent d'initier une association de parents. Il souhaite ajouter une fonctionnalité dans la liste permettant de sélectionner "Idem que P1" si les adresses des parents 1 et 2 sont les mêmes (pour les cas où les parents ne sont pas divorcés).
Model set context updated.

Oui, c'est tout à fait possible de mettre en place cette fonctionnalité dans Excel. Voici une approche simple pour le faire :

### Option 1 : Utiliser une liste déroulante pour choisir "Idem que P1" ou une adresse différente

1. **Créer une liste déroulante pour P2** :
   - Sélectionne les cellules dans la colonne **P2.Adresse** (ou toute autre colonne que tu souhaites appliquer).
   - Va dans l'onglet **Données** et clique sur **Validation des données**.
   - Dans la fenêtre qui s'ouvre, choisis **Liste** comme critère de validation.
   - Dans le champ **Source**, entre les options suivantes : `Idem que P1, Adresse différente`.
   - Cela ajoutera une liste déroulante dans les cellules sélectionnées avec les deux options.

2. **Utiliser une formule pour copier l'adresse de P1** :
   - Si "Idem que P1" est sélectionné dans la liste, tu peux utiliser une formule pour copier automatiquement l'adresse de **P1**. Par exemple, dans la cellule **P2.Adresse** :
     ```excel
     =SI(cellule_liste="Idem que P1", P1.Adresse, "")
     ```
   - Remplace `cellule_liste` par la référence de la cellule où se trouve la liste déroulante.

### Option 2 : Utiliser un bouton pour copier automatiquement l'adresse de P1

Tu peux ajouter un bouton dans Excel qui, lorsqu'on clique dessus, copie automatiquement l'adresse de **P1** dans **P2** si les adresses sont identiques. Voici comment :

1. **Ajoute un bouton dans Excel** :
   - Va dans l'onglet **Développeur** (si tu ne l'as pas activé, tu peux le faire dans les options d'Excel).
   - Clique sur **Insérer** et choisis un bouton.
   - Place le bouton à côté de la cellule où tu veux l'ajouter.

2. **Écris une macro pour copier l'adresse** :
   - Associe une macro à ce bouton. Tu peux écrire une macro simple qui copiera automatiquement l'adresse de **P1** dans **P2**.

Voici un exemple de code VBA pour la macro :
```vba
Sub CopierAdresseP1()
    If Range("P2.Adresse").Value = "Idem que P1" Then
        Range("P2.Adresse").Value = Range("P1.Adresse").Value
    End If
End Sub
```
N'oublie pas de remplacer les références des cellules par les bonnes adresses de ton tableau.

Avec ces deux méthodes, tu peux permettre aux parents de choisir soit "Idem que P1" pour copier l'adresse, soit de saisir une nouvelle adresse s'ils vivent séparément.

Si tu as besoin d'aide pour implémenter l'une de ces options, n'hésite pas à me le dire !
c'est ça que je dois faire ?

Dans Excel, pour tester plusieurs conditions, tu dois utiliser la fonction `OU` (équivalent du `OR` en anglais). Voici comment traduire ta formule correctement :

```excel
=SI(OU($R$10="Oui", $R$10=""); K11; "")
```

### Explication :
- **`OU`** : Permet de tester plusieurs conditions. Dans ton cas, tu veux vérifier si **$R$10** est égal à "Oui" ou si **$R$10** est vide.
- Si l'une des deux conditions est vraie, la valeur de **K11** sera retournée, sinon, une chaîne vide sera affichée.

Les double-pipes `||` ne sont pas utilisés dans Excel, il faut utiliser la fonction **`OU`** pour les tests de conditions multiples.

Voici comment faire pour appliquer la règle à toutes les lignes :

   ```

   Cela signifie que pour chaque ligne dans la plage sélectionnée (S11:U100), la mise en forme conditionnelle vérifiera la colonne R de la ligne correspondante.

### Conclusion :

### Option : Utiliser la mise en forme conditionnelle pour masquer le contenu

Bien que tu ne puisses pas directement masquer les colonnes sans VBA, tu peux rendre les colonnes visuellement plus agréables en utilisant une combinaison de mise en forme conditionnelle et de réglage de la police pour masquer le texte.

### Si tu es ouvert à une solution simple avec VBA
Si tu souhaites vraiment avoir un bouton pour masquer/afficher les colonnes en fonction de la sélection d’une cellule, la solution avec VBA serait assez simple à mettre en œuvre et ne demande qu’un petit script.

Pour info voici la capture d'écran et les enfants.
Si F5 est Oui il faut afficher les colonnes G à M sinon il faut les masquer.
Et 
Si F6 est Oui il faut afficher les colonnes N à U sinon il faut les masquer.

Voici un petit script VBA que tu peux utiliser pour afficher ou masquer les colonnes en fonction des valeurs des cellules **F5** et **F6**.

### Étapes pour ajouter le script :

1. **Ouvre l'éditeur VBA** : Appuie sur `Alt + F11` pour ouvrir l'éditeur de VBA dans Excel.
2. **Ajoute le script** :
   - Dans l'éditeur, fais un clic droit sur **ThisWorkbook** dans l'explorateur de projet à gauche et choisis **Insérer** > **Module**.
   - Copie et colle le script suivant dans le module :

```vba
Sub AfficherMasquerColonnes()
    ' Pour Parent 1 (Colonnes G à M)
    If Range("F5").Value = "Oui" Then
        Columns("G:M").EntireColumn.Hidden = False
    Else
        Columns("G:M").EntireColumn.Hidden = True
    End If

    ' Pour Parent 2 (Colonnes N à U)
    If Range("F6").Value = "Oui" Then
        Columns("N:U").EntireColumn.Hidden = False
    Else
        Columns("N:U").EntireColumn.Hidden = True
    End If
End Sub
```

3. **Exécute le script** :
   - Appuie sur `Alt + F8`, sélectionne **AfficherMasquerColonnes** dans la liste des macros, et clique sur **Exécuter**.

### Option : Automatisation à chaque changement
Si tu souhaites que ce script s'exécute automatiquement dès que tu modifies les cellules **F5** ou **F6**, tu peux ajouter le code suivant dans **ThisWorkbook** ou dans la feuille spécifique :

```vba
Private Sub Worksheet_Change(ByVal Target As Range)
    If Not Intersect(Target, Range("F5:F6")) Is Nothing Then
        Call AfficherMasquerColonnes
    End If
End Sub
```

Cela déclenchera l'exécution du script chaque fois que **F5** ou **F6** est modifié.

### Résultat :
- Si **F5** est égal à "Oui", les colonnes **G à M** seront affichées, sinon elles seront masquées.
- Si **F6** est égal à "Oui", les colonnes **N à U** seront affichées, sinon elles seront masquées.
